You can playback the video and freeze frame were ever you like and make a photo copy of it. Great for active kids, just record them. Playback the video and pause when you see that perfect moment. Then save it as a photo! Looks every bit as good as the regular photos, absolutely no difference. The Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-W290 is also one of the coolest, most modern looking cameras in it's price range! It's very sturdy and well built. As with all Sony products! Great battery life from the included lithium ion rechargable battery! In it's price range the Sony DSC-W290 is very hard to beat! Buy one, I'm sure you'll agree! It's the BEST in it's class! Plus, you get great professional Carl Zeiss German lenses! The BEST in the industry! Plus, they are used by NASA on the Space Shuttle!

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Emerson Poli
Reviews.Content: Guys, I've bought a w290 recently, I love it! W290 is very easy to use and the pictures are wonderful, the movies are very good quality. It's really worth.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the money, poor image stabilization
Reviews.Author: Alex Gossett
Reviews.Content: My only issue with this camera is Image Stabilization, it isn't as good as Canon's. I bought the camera for it's features, 12 megapixels and HD quality Video. Image Stabilization is a big issue for me, my hands shake. My existing camera, a Canon with IS, handled this issue very well. The Sony did not. When taking video it was very jittery, even with IS on. The Canon doesn't have that problem, so I can only assume it's more affective at dealing with the problem. If IS isn't an issue for you then this is a great value for the money, nothing else comes close to it's still image and video resolution for the price.

Reviews.Title: HD Video makes this a great deal.
Reviews.Author: Peter James
Reviews.Content: First of all, close pictures with no movement look outstanding!  And that is what I bought this camera for.  What really got me to love this camera is the video mode, which shoots in 720p HD.  I have uploaded some videos to my PS3 and the quality is awesome.  My kids are 5 and 7, and I will now finally have a quality hd recorder to save some of their childhood memories.  And like I said, the pictures are nice too.  -1 star because of limited zoom and pics with movement.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot..
Reviews.Author: Clashcity Rocker "Clashcity Rocker"
Reviews.Content: Managed to drop my old camera on the beach on holiday, and the zoom became unsurprisingly temperamental, so I needed a replacement in a hurry.  Choose the Sony because that's what I know, and have always found them easy to use, and exceptionally quick startup times.This new generation of cameras really does take things to a new level.  Best of all, Sony have rationalized the controls and modes to make the camera even simpler to use than previous generations (whilst still maintaining the flexibility of manual mode).The photos I have taken so far, all look amazing, with very vivid and accurate colour reproduction, and the HD Video modes look great.About the only thing I can really fault with the camera, is the lack of a HD video cable in the box, if you want to play HD directly from the camera you need to buy a lead for it.  However it's no big deal for me, as I transfer everything to PC first and edit and make my video/picture compositions and play the HD video that way.In summary, a 5star performer without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: Bad customer service outweighs everything else
Reviews.Author: Sophia Grace
Reviews.Content: Beware, if you like this camera buy it only if you believe you will never have to get anything fixed.  Sony's customer service/relations is surprisingly terrible.  I sent a product in for a superficial fix (at sony's request as part of a recall), I got it back with the lens not working.  Understandable, it happens. But sony refused to fix it unless I paid for it or produced my proof of purchase to show it was still under warranty.  After 3 hours speaking to various people over the course of two weeks (so it was not just one random person, but seems to be policy), Sony insisted that they would not fix the camera, they basically said 'the camera has a problem and we don't fix anything for free without a proof of purchase, regardless of circumstances'.  Blew me away, they would not consider that they could have been at fault, that I would not have sent camera in unless they had asked me to in the first place.  Customer relations and marketing have to get together and talk, marketing is spending millions to get me to buy all sorts of high margin products (playstation, flat screens, audio equipment, video cameras, etc) and customer service blows it all away over a fifty dollar fix.

Reviews.Title: Bad photo quality
Reviews.Author: kmfieleke
Reviews.Content: This camera is feature laden and a great size, but it fails in the one basic area most people buy a camera.  It doesn't take good pictures!  Way too many of our pictures turn out blurry, colors aren't vivid, lighting issues aren't handled well by the software.  We bought this less than 6 months ago and are so disappointed we're already looking for a new camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Sony Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: W. Uncapher
Reviews.Content: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and Super Steady Shot Image Stabilization (Black)I recently bought the Sony DSC-W290 digital camera with NO REGRETS! I looked for weeks at all the brands and read all the reviews, before deciding on the Sony DSC-W290. Sony cameras rated the best in reliability over a 5 year period in two top consumer magazines! Glad I bought a Sony! The Sony DSC-W290 takes excellant high quality pictures and high-def video. The video sound is also in stereo! My friends Panasonic with similar features as my Sony, records in mono! Believe me there's a big difference in sound quality! The Sony sounds more realistic and picks up the sounds better and clearer than the Panasonic! Something to consider since the Sony DSC-W290 takes such great quality high-def video. I feel high-def video has to have stereo sound, why wound any manufactuer make a camera with high-def video without it? Much to my surprise Sony is way ahead of their competitors on this, most other brands record in mono, just like the Panasonic. The Sony DSC-W290 is very well built and solid! Very easy to use, just like all Sony digital cameras! They improved their menu options on this model making it even easier to use over previous ones. The Sony DSC-W290 has a metal front and back case, most others are all plastic, something else to consider! Plus the Sony DSC-W290 just down right looks better and more high tech than all their competitors! It's very compact with tons of features and capabilities! The photo and video quality is the best I've seen in a point and shoot digital camera in this price range. My prints turn out so well they look like a professional took them! I love the Carl Zeiss lenses Sony uses! They are German and used by professional labs worldwide! Also, Carl Zeiss lenses are used by NASA on the Space Shuttle! Something else to consider when deciding which camera to buy. The double anti-blur and optical image stabilization features work great! I purposely tried to make the Sony screw up and couldn't, I'm amazed, perfect sharp, clear photos every time! The Sony DSC-W290 is so automatic, put it in Intelligent Auto mode, and the camera does the rest. There's also manual settings available, but why bother. Buy the Sony DSC-W290 and you won't be disappointed! You'll love it! They are selling so well that many stores and online retailers are out-of-stock! So don't wait around, or you may have to wait till they get re-stocked! The Sony DSC-W290 is very hard to beat!!!UPDATE!!!I've owned this amazing camera for over a month now, just had to update my review!I can't say enough good things about it! All my friends and family love this camera and the high quality of the photos it takes! Everywhere I go people ask me about it! They love the simplicity of it, the looks, and the quality of the camera and it's photo taking ability! People say it's such a high-tech and good looking camera. I've taken nearly 500 photos already, and just can't believe the brilliant color of the photos from this Sony camera! The build quality of this Sony camera is top-notch, it's so well built and just out right rock solid! I've sold three poeple on this camera already. They were so impressed, they just had to buy one for themselves! I don't at all understand some of the negative reviews! I think some people just don't know how to use it. Which is hard to believe, because it's so simple to use. If you're looking for a great point and shoot camera that's a terrific value for the price! Do yourself a favor and buy the Sony CyberShot DSC-W290! It's the BEST!!!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas W. Burdette "tom"
Reviews.Content: this product is awesome  would diffidently tell friend to buy one when they need a nice camera

Reviews.Title: A solid digital camera
Reviews.Author: Charlie G
Reviews.Content: The DSC-W290 provides the high quality photos I expected.  The HD quality videos that can be taken with the camera is a definite plus for use in making still shot/video movies.  The menus are intuitive and the large display is great to work with.  I am pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Camera Purchase
Reviews.Author: David L. Hahn "Dave Hahn"
Reviews.Content: An outstanding product, good price, and fast service.  No complaints.  I will be purchasing again from Amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: decent camera, nice features, not much control
Reviews.Author: E. T.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an upgrade to my sony W50.  It's got a nice wide angle zoom, HD movies (mp4s that I couldn't edit in windows movie maker), and all the latest automation from sony (smile shutter etc.)I was a little disappointed.  The photos were better, but not a lot better, than my old camera.  I have some photography experience, and I knew there weren't manual controls, but I still found it hard to know what the automatic settings were doing.  I like to see what aperature and iso are going to be used, and have some control.  But it wasn't user friendly.I like the small size, but in the end I returned it and bought a Panasonic TZ5 with a 10X zoom + all the other features of the sony.  I think the pictures are better, and I've been happy with my decision.If you always use auto mode, and you want the small size, this would be a decent choice.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera - Still Need to improve
Reviews.Author: Khoa D. Nguyen "Khoa Ngyen"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera. I love everythings on it. For features and specification you can look at on websites. There is one one important thing that I like to share my problem with this camera here:I cant take a good shot in moving subject in low light even with a flash is on.For examples: In a club, people at night party when they are moving slowly (natural shots).This camera doesn't has a manual mode so it is very difficult to take a good pictures for moving subjects.Shutter is seem to be like at 1/30 seconds all the time when taking at low light even with flash on. I really hate that even at high ISO too.With manual mode I just set shutter to 1/125 seconds and turn on flash then I can take razor sharp not out of focus of people are dancing in a club or party.Sony must improve this camera by creating another mode like "High shutter", "Dance Club", or "Moving subjects"...or adding the manual mode for this camera.Since Sony has built in shake free features, It is good for keep the camera steady when taking picture with bear hand without tripod, but it is useless for taking moving subjects at low light.Other features are great love the quality and HD movie.I guess I have to wait for a Sony W350 if sony has later...

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: SN
Reviews.Content: I think I'd rate myself as a pretty average camera user.  I need a camera that will take nice clear pictures without a lot of programming, or selecting the right settings.  I need a basic click and go camera.  Unfortunately, the Sony Cybershot DSC-w290 didn't meet my needs.I took my camera on a trip to visit family, take pictures of my new nephew, and to take pictures at a graduation.  The pictures we took outdoors on a cloudy day didn't turn out well.  It seemed like the camera kept focusing on objects in the background instead of the background.  When we used pictures using the zoom, the pictures were grainy.  Most frustrating was that when I took pictures indoors, the pictures were really grainy, and the focus just couldn't get very sharp.  One requirement for this camera was that it take pictures indoors in low light--and it couldn't at all.  I don't know if this is a problem with this particular camera, but anything we took a picture of that had a lot of white in it (like white tents) there was this weird halo/cloudy effect.  I have an older Nikon camera that's a 4 megapixel, and it takes much better pictures.Overall, I wouldn't recommend buying this camera.  I had a Nikon before, and perhaps it's what I'll go back to using.

Reviews.Title: Years ago when I've first bought it, I became completely satisfied.
Reviews.Author: Fabrizio
Reviews.Content: This last purchase was done in order ot replace my old one that got water inside when diving (o-ring problems).

Reviews.Title: BUENO
Reviews.Author: Mantias
Reviews.Content: excelente producto, era lo que en realidad estaba esperando, me llego a tiempo, excelente compra, .) :) :) :) :)

Reviews.Title: Years of perfection and satisfaction!
Reviews.Author: Allen of Pensacola, FL
Reviews.Content: I originally bought this camera 4 years ago for my wife, who needed a point and shoot camera to have a chance of taking at least one great picture. Well,  while giving her instructions,  I discovered several things about the DSC-W290 that made me want to use it as well. I have taken over 500 shots with it and all have turned out just fine. Even the videos I shot of the rising creek in our back yard in the pouring rain turned out great. The only extra cost for me so far was an additional battery and charger.  Just this past Saturday we were dressed to attend a 50th wedding anniversary party for our friends.  I had never used the self-timer feature.  Took a few shots of my self and then a few with my wife.  They came out great.  I also took shots at the party in dim lighting,  and every shot was a winner,  even those of our friens dancing.  I have uploaded the entire event from the SD card and sent them via email to our friends.  I have read some reviews that were somewhat negative which prompted me to write my own review.  I am perfectly happy with the DSC-290 which has outlasted all of my more expensive cameras by more than two years without a glitch. If you are not a professional, I recommend it without any reservations...

Reviews.Title: Owned for over 2 years now... most pics unusable
Reviews.Author: K. Huenink "WisconsinMom"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for awhile now. It was purchased to mainly take pics of my kids, trips to the zoos, aquariums, snap shots and the like.  I had to replace my previous 2002 Canon ?? camera because i dropped it and killed the LCD screen.  I am not a pro by any sense of the word. However I know good pics when I see them and I haven't seen any for a long time now.  Just to compare my old camera had just came back from St Lucia with over 500 quick snap pics that took your breath away even fast shots on a helicopter! With this Sony most of my pics are blurry, have a reddish tint to them, double vision look, macro pops on during scenery pics, pics with flash are washed out, or it doesn't use flash when it needs it. It focuses on odd things like waste paper baskets instead of peoples faces, it takes FOREVER to process even with an upgraded card. I can look back and count maybe a 100 pics in thousands that are worth keeping if it wasn't for my priceless growing kids faces. Really I feel cheated. I have searched online and reset to factory defaults/professional cleanings etc. several times over. I have read the entire owners manual. Just a few days ago I compared my pics of the same scene to those of my fathers Canon Powershot? and his pics were AMAZING compared to mine. Selling this one now before I miss out on even more memories. My husband has the smaller version of this Sony and even his pics are better than mine.

Reviews.Title: Great if you want a blurry pic after the action is over
Reviews.Author: Laura Sheree
Reviews.Content: I have to first acknowledge that I don't know much about photography, but I am generally competent in other areas of life and have had reasonable success in the past with other point and shoot cameras.  After 2 years of having this camera I have quite a large collection of blurry pictures of my kids just after they did something interesting.  I have tried numerous settings and nothing seems to have helped.  Sometimes I can't get the shutter pushed down (maybe it's trying to do some auto adjustments or maybe too soon after previous shot?).  I am finally giving up on this camera and I suspect I should have done so a while ago.

Reviews.Title: DON"T BUY THIS CAMERA IT HAS PROBLEMS!
Reviews.Author: Judith Knott Tyler
Reviews.Content: Before you buy a Sony Cybershot DSC W290 Google  the following sony DSC W290  "turn the power off and on again".  We purchased a Sony Cybershot DSC W290  Digital Camera from Amazon.com in March 2010. The camera began malfunctioning before it was a year old, the lens opening partially and not allowing the camera to operate giving a message "turn power off and on again" each time the camera was turned on. From the number of similar posts online this problem is very common with this camera. We sent it into Sony to be repaired as instructed on 2 16 2011, the camera was repaired under warranty and returned to us Less than 8 months later the camera began having the same problem. I contacted Sony about the reoccuring problem, their reply is copied below. Evidently they don't think much of their repair department either.  Don't buy this cameraThank you for contacting Sony Support.I'm sorry that the error message "TURN THE POWER OFF AND ON AGAIN" is displayed on the LCD screen of the Camera. Based on the information you've provided, I suggest that you power reset the Camera and check the operation.  1. Turn off the camera.  2. Remove the battery pack.  3. Allow the camera to remain without power for 30 seconds.  4. Reinsert the battery pack.  5. Turn on the camera.If the issue persists; unfortunately, service will be required, as the Camera is out of the warranty period. You can find warranty information as well as our available repair options online at:  [...]The warranty period for a product that has been repaired by a Sony Service Center (SSC) is 90 days for parts and 90 days for labor or the remainder of the factory warranty, whichever is longer.IMPORTANT: Some repairs may not be warranted by the Sony Service Center (SSC). The SSC will provide notification if the repair will not be warranted.Also, you may contact our dedicated Customer Relations Team and check for the available options. I've provided a direct link to reach them:  [...]Thank you for understanding.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-W290
Reviews.Author: L. Natali
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to fit in my purse for special occassions.  Primarily a wedding.  While it took good pictures for the first 2 months of ownership, it began to fail horribly thereafter.  After having the camera serviced twice in less than 2 years, it is now dead again.  Perhaps this is a lemon, but no one should have to pay $200 for a brick.  DO NOT PURCHASE THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: worst buy ever....
Reviews.Author: nolita
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera. twice. the first time within a week, we found it defective as one day we turned it on and half the screen/view-finder was blank. Ok, fine defective.  We had otherwise liked it during that week it worked, so returned it and chose the same camera.  This was during our wedding so having a camera was important.  On our honeymoon, a piece of dust got into the lens housing, causing a black fuzzy blob to be in every picture.  So imagine, going to Greece on your honeymoon, stunning views and landscapes with a big ugly blob in EVERY picture.  So, terrible right?  Must be a fluke?  A one time problem.  We returned and sent the camera off to Sony to remove the dust, as the lens had to be opened up.  came back......a year later, we now have ANOTHER bit of dust in the lens, so another black spot in EVERY picture.  I have had a lot of cameras, and put them through some rough treatment, I hate writing reviews, but seriously, spend your money on a camera by a company that actually specializes in making cameras like canon, pentax or kodak or something.  I won't buy anything from sony again.

Reviews.Title: Dust Under Lens
Reviews.Author: laur
Reviews.Content: Watch out... Sony says that it's impossible for things to get under the lens, but dust got under mine & now ruins all of my shots of the sky with dark spots from the dust.Sony says I'd have to pay to have it repaired, even though the camera is advertised as a closed system with no possibility of anything getting inside the lens.I say... Buy Canon, screw Sony.  No accountability.

Reviews.Title: horrible
Reviews.Author: W. Douh
Reviews.Content: i have no idea how this lousy camera gets a 4/5 star rating here,its photos look horrible,the worst-quality photographs i have ever seen in my life came from this camera!!

Reviews.Title: Total Brick
Reviews.Author: Tyrone Jenkins
Reviews.Content: This camera worked for 11 months then lens assembly failed to operate. Sent in for warranty repair. Worked for 2 months after repair and now the lens assembly has failed again. Save your money and buy something else. Took great pictures when the camera worked, but it is too much money to spend on a camera that turns into a brick after 12 months.

Reviews.Title: Broke TWICE after minimal use
Reviews.Author: A. Lambert
Reviews.Content: This is the worst camera I have ever owned and I will NEVER buy another Sony again.  I had a cannon elph for over 5 years and it worked wonderfully.  Since pixel numerosity, HD, etc., have improved so much since I purchased that one, I thought I was "upgrading" to the Sony.  The pictures were not bad with it and the video looked good, actually.  I never abused it, kept it cased always when not in use, put screen protectors on it, etc....Essentially all the things I did with my Cannon that kept it working for over 5 years.  The Sony broke in the middle of my honeymoon less than 3 months after I had purchased it (which was only about its 3rd use).  I had it repaired at a Sony store in London (at least they honored the warranty).  It broke again less than 3 months after that on the very first use after we got back home.  Do not waste your money on this camera!  Sony is now a 4 letter word in my house!

Reviews.Title: I Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Danny Yu
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is true, as from other reviews this camera- Has a tendency to become blurry (What point and shoot camera doesn't?)- Is a bit chunky and big in size for a newer model of the Sony W generation- Cannot zoom for video modeWith all that said, it is still a nice camera- The picture quality along with the relatively high amount of megapixels (12.1) is superbWhen having taken a good photograph, the colors for a point and shoot are wonderful!- Sometimes, this camera does wonders and can take photos that compare to DSLR.- THe 5x zoom is really nice to have. For the most part, the picture quality even when zoomed has much clarity.Overall, if you could look past some of the drawbacks, you will love this camera like I would. But, if you had the extra moolah/dough/cash, just get the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-T900 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom and Super Steady Shot Image Stabilization (Black)

Reviews.Title: Terrible warranty service
Reviews.Author: John "John"
Reviews.Content: We got a W290 as a gift and it inexplicably stopped working 2 months later.  All the menus functioned, but there was no light getting through the lens to the camera.  It just took black pictures.We sent it back to Sony and after about a week they said it was unrepairable and corroded.  No explanation other than "humidity" (we live in Colorado).  Even though we were still in the warranty period, they said it was not covered.  They then tried to sell me one of their newer cameras.I'm hesitant to buy another Sony camera after this experience.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: JNPV
Reviews.Content: The DSC-W290 is an excellent camera. The picture quality is great and the wide angle lens is fun to experiment with. The display is large and crisp. Battery life so far seems good. Features are easy to use and the intelligent auto setting is quite effective. It is a little larger than I would have liked but considering the capabilities of this camera - I've gotten used to the size. I would recommend this camera to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: the best camera ever
Reviews.Author: Terence L. Gorman
Reviews.Content: I have had a few cameras in my day but so far this one is the best that I have ever owned. It is really easy to use takes great pics and is just all around a really nice camera anyone looking for a non slr  THIS IS THE ONE

Reviews.Title: Good, but not great
Reviews.Author: Shane C. Webb "webb157"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera a few months ago to replace a 4 year old Canon Elph.  I'm generally happy with it considering the price, and C-Net gave it very good reviews.  Had I known about it I would have bought the DSC-H20/B 10.1 instead, because this camera really isn't that much smaller.+Price to feature ratio is the best out there+Smile Detection works better than any other camera I've seen.  This has been a great feature for capturing my camera shy toddler.+Picture quality is pretty high.+Video quality is pretty high, and I don't mind not being able to zoom.-Auto focus is an absolute must.  I could just snap with my old elph and the quality would still be pretty good.  With this camera you have to use the focus.-Picture button is really annoying.  It's pretty hard to focus without accidentally snapping a pic.  The button itself is too small.  I thought I could live with it, but it's pretty annoying.-Zoom button is a bit of a pain as well.  It's on the back of the camera as opposed to near the snap button like on other cameras.-Can't zoom on video.  I knew this when I bought, but I don't use the video feature very much.-Pretty bulky camera.  Atleast 30% bigger than my old elph.Generally the picture quality is good, but the ease of use is poor.  I think sony just wanted to be the first to get HD video in a point & shoot camera of this class, and released it quickly without working out the kinks.  Unfortunately this happened at the time when I desperately needed a new camera.  I'm happy with the picture and video quality, but now that this camera has a lot of competition, I would not buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Sleek camera, but had to return...
Reviews.Author: James R. Wilson "Movieguy"
Reviews.Content: You will not find a cooler looking and feeling camera anywhere,but alas, the following two issues were deal breakers for meand I opted to return the camera and by a Panasoci Lumic DMC-ZR1instead.Sony issues:1) NO ZOOM ABILITY in video mode.2) Very soft photos - inconsistent photo quality.I really wanted to love this camera because it is just so coollooking and solid, but seeing soft blurry blotches on facesin my photos is just not acceptable.And how do they not include a zoom ability on the video mode?The Panasonic that I bought instead takes care of both issues.While the low-light photo quality is not terrific on the Panasoniceither, the overall photo quality is better. And now I can zoomin video mode - and with greater zoom ability, 12X.

Reviews.Title: Best Mid Range camera
Reviews.Author: D. Pirozzi "Limp Cactus"
Reviews.Content: We have used our Sony Cyber-Shot camber for about a month.  We have had no issues.  Like any other electronic gadget, it takes time to know the controls and use it.  This camera has one of the best lenses and takes better pictures than a friends 15 Megapixel camera.  We love the Stabilization, it works as stated.  My mother was able to use this camera and take perfect shots.  Previously, when using an older camera without the stabilization, all her pictures were blurry.  I would recommend this to anyone who wants quality photos and doesn't mind the extra weight (which is not really an issue with us).

Reviews.Title: Love Sony and this camera is one example of why...
Reviews.Author: JWPluto
Reviews.Content: There's a point-and-shoot out there for everyone's needs. Fact is, there's too many to choose from. I narrowed down my choices based on mfg and features. In this price range, there are over 40 product claiming the same or similar capabilities. Finally, I found that no one camera is perfect, but I look at Sony because they're consistent. Regardless of the "cons" reflected by other reviews, this is as good as most any comparable camera. Of course there are feature differences. That's the way companies distinguish theirs from the others.Complaints about the display quality are ridiculous. If the display was HD or near HD resolution, you'd be paying big bucks for it . If you feel the special cables should be included, you'd be paying for that too, and then the 'cons' become, "it's more expensive that it's competitors. It boils down to a 'preview' of the picture to determine the acceptance or not, but the quality and final aspects of digital camera photos are best measured on your computer. That's why it's so easy to download and why so many computers and printers come with memory card readers built in.Bottom line - it's a very good camera and priced right for what Sony includes.

Reviews.Title: A camera that makes you look like an expert!
Reviews.Author: Shadow Man
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after a recent trip to Disney World - I only wish I had bought it BEFORE the trip. We traveled with friends, who had just bought this very same Cyber-Shot. Nearly all of their DSC-W290 shots and HD video came out awesome. The shots I took with my 5.0 megapixel couldn't compare. After my return from Disney and seeing the potential for this camera, I immediately ordered the DSC-W290 from Amazon for my very own.The "first" DSC-W290 arrived from Amazon with some problems. All my lighter-scene shots had a small cloudy spot, about the size of an eraser head in the upper left corner. It was in the same place every time. The cloudy spot appeared in actual printed photos and on the LCD display. I called Sony because the sticker on the box said to call them (not the retailer) if there are any problems. Sony's solution was for me to send in this week-old-camera for repair. Not happening. I then contacted Amazon via their automated return/exchange process. Oh man, how smooth this process was. It took me all of 3 minutes to complete Amazon's on-line exhange form and wham, a replacement camera was in my hands 48 hours later. I then sent the defective one back to them using the retun label Amazon provided me. I applaud Amazon for making this potentally bad situation a non-issue. Bravo Amazon!The replacement camera was put to use almost immediately. I took munerous still and action shots during the recent December 09' blizzard the blanketed the DC area. In a word, phenominal. I took multiple shots of the same scene, varying just the scene setting from "easy" to pre-set "snow" backgroud. Both shots - incredible. Holiday shots were equally as nice. The camera compensates nicely for indoor low light. The only shot I struggle with is nightime shots that have movement (i.e. parade). Oddly enough, nightime HD video comes out great with no special adjustment. Go figure.Fit and finish is seemed better than other comparably priced cameras I looked at. As for battery life, have a spare on-hand (although I do take a lot of shots so it's probably me).Again, a major kudo's to Amazon for their customer service process. I almost bought at another, online retailer just to save a a few bucks ... I am sooo glad I didn't.

Reviews.Title: The best Point & Shoot camera in it's category
Reviews.Author: A. Wuppuluri
Reviews.Content: This is truly an amazing product. It takes great pictures and the camera comes with some very easy to use useful features. I like "Smiley Button" feature the best. Click the smiley button and let the camera go to work. The camera will take a picture whenever anyone in the frame smiles. You don't have to worry if you got the shot at the right moment. The camera also takes 720P HD Video. The only feature missing is availability of zoom in the video mode. Overall, I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Everyone's a Critic
Reviews.Author: B. liu
Reviews.Content: i've purchased this product to replace my w80 since i lost it at an airport -_-" but anyway i loved the fact that i got it for sub200 when it was a dealbreaker here at amazon but i'll give some of the pros and cons so you can make your own decision.  the first thing i noticed when i turned on the camera was how big the lens eye was compared to other digicams i've had.  random factoid but nonetheless something for you to know.pros:- the camera takes 2 shots in a row when it senses low light or over brightness and the 2nd shot is either increased/decreased iso or increased/decreased EV.  at first i didnt like it but there are some times where the 2nd shot looked better than the first because it let more light in.- the 5x optical zoom.- the full screen with no viewfinder.  but i managed to crack the LCD screen by dropping it on a single point -_-" cost me about$60 to repair it but nonetheless i hardly ever used the viewfinder in my previous cameras so if you're like me, this is a pro- comestically i like the bronze/champagne color which was why i got this camera- like all sony cybershots, picture quality is great.  for all cameras in ideal conditions picture quality is great but i prefer the sony lenses because the colors are almost perfect to life.  i bought my brother a canon 860 last year because i didnt want him to have the same camera as me and i noticed that his colors come out more vivid naturally without having the vivid color option on.  i've used nikon point and shoots from my friends and their photos from what i seen comes out soft and aren't bold or vivid.cons:- in my w80 i was able to turn off the display screen but in this camera i cant.  i mean for obvious reasons that it doesnt have a viewfinder but still, it would be nice to take snapshots without telling the world your camera is on- the 2nd shot as described above is here because sometimes i prefer not to have the 2nd shot taken if i have it on a particular setting but if i want to turn it off i have to go to the menu function- the shutter button isnt pronounced as my w80 so when i first got it, i had a hard time finding it.  it takes some getting used to but still it's a con- it's not as compact as my w80 but it's still fairly compact in a waythe first thing that i wanted to put it as a con but i can't is because of the macro function.  macro almost does not exist for this camera if you wanna take an upclose shot, compared to my w80, but i had to remind myself that the reason why i bought this camera was for POINT AND SHOOT.the second thing is in low light situations without flash, the photos comes out a bit grainy... but then again, if i wanted something that looked more professional and gave me multiple options to tweak i would've gotten and spent more money.  it is what it is everyone... a good budget point and shoot camera.  everyone's a critic.i didnt mention the smile feature on this camera because i almost never use it... but if i do use it a lot i'll update this and let you know if it's anything spectacularall in all... i'm very happy with my camera and if you dont like it, you're more than welcomed to return it.  to each his own.

Reviews.Title: Cyber-shot is a Winner!!
Reviews.Author: Jonathon W. Vail "20th Century Escapee"
Reviews.Content: Chose this camera after trying a Cyber-shot my brother has. This model (dsc-w290)was the next grade up. I paid less and got more, feature-wise than my brother's carmera. Pros: easy manual zoom ability; macro setting (X 1.2); built in lens protection (retractible); manual override for flash, mode et al; great auto-focus feature. Cons: Memory stick not included ($35 to $60 extra cost), somewhat over-simplified explanation of features in the manual, short battery life, protective case not included ( more $).This is my first digital camera. Overall I am very pleased. Although it seemed to have a short battery life on the rechargeable, I do not have anything to compare it to. I am going to look for an auto charger. I am very happy with the manual capabilities as well as the automated, intelligence setting. Allows you to "set it and forget it". Hugely impressed with the picture clarity and quality. Easy to download pics onto my PC. I would definitely recommend this camera. Still many features to explore.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Mark Wallig "Mark W"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.  Compatible with wife's Sony W-220 digital camera.  Same cords, battery, battery charger.  One less thing to pack on our travels.

Reviews.Title: The Good, The Bad, The Ugly.
Reviews.Author: Timo "T"
Reviews.Content: First of all; I purchased this camera specifically to take pictures and shoot movies underwater.I combined this camera with the Sony MPK-WE Marine Pack, which I've reviewed at that particular product site.Most of my usage, and the basis for this review, has therefore been below the surface.The Good:Instead of just good I would like to say: "The Awesome".The best feature of this camera - for me - is the fact that it has color modes for white balance underwater; one for blue water and  even one for greenish water. This helps to really bring out the appropriate colors underwater, and produces stunning images and movies. All the underwater movies (720p) look absolutely amazing and crisp on a HD TV set (40 inch).This camera also has a setting for the "intelligent" detection of scenery and lighting. This setting seems to work quite well in detecting landscape or macro mode, or settings for underwater.With a 16GB Memory Stick PRO Duo there is plenty of space for tons of pictures and movies.The Bad:Somehow with all the latest and greatest technology on board, this camera will not allow you to zoom while shooting a movie. This is really too bad, as sometimes it is nice to go from an overview shot into more of a close-up.In all fairness; shooting a movie underwater does not really lend itself to zooming, as there is invariably some difficulty in holding the camera still.Also; this camera uses the Sony Memory Stick PRO Duo, and with SD cards becoming more of the norm, it seems silly for Sony to keep on peddling their own media.The Ugly:While this is a great camera (and underwater housing combo) for what I needed it to do, the most annoying and frustrating drawback is the fact that the focus while shooting movies is extremely poor. I understand that is is difficult enough to focus on a moving object in water that is also moving, but even in great shots where there is only one large object (say a turtle) in the foreground, the focus continually drifts in and out. At first I thought it had to do with the variable light distorted and morphed by the waves above, but even on cloudy days there were the same focus problems. A dark subject on a light background, or the reverse; nothing seems to be good enough to hold focus all the way through, or even just for more than a couple of seconds. I have tried different focus / metering settings, all to no avail.Bottom line:In the end, and despite the frustrating focussing issue, this camera still gets four stars, as it has tons of useful features and it does produce amazing underwater footage and images.I have included a few still images captured with this camera, but the movies I have made with it are even more stunning.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Miss Foxy
Reviews.Content: I really LOVE this camera! It takes really good clear crisp pictures in vivid color. The HD video quality is AWESOME! I would highly recommend this camera. The only cons are you can't zoom in while recording and it takes a memory stick instead of an SD card. This is annoying to have to buy new memory seeing as though I already had several SD cards from previous cameras. But I found a good deal for a memory stick on Amazon and I can deal with no zoom while recording. The crystal clear HD makes up for that (search the camera model on you tube to see sample video). Bottom line, this is a wonderful camera to have and if you're thinking about getting it- go ahead! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Good, but better choices are out there.
Reviews.Author: The Folded Space
Reviews.Content: I only kept this camera for a short time. I chose this model initially for the wide(ish) angle lens, but like virtually all 12MP cameras with tiny 0.28 cm² sensors, the image quality disappoints. There are a few manual controls, but I could find no way to do a long exposure. The video quality is so-so to poor without ideal lighting conditions, though the sound recording is actually quite good. Lack of zoom during video recording was a deal breaker that I discovered after purchase. If you can live with these sorts of limitations, you might find a tiny Casio better for a point-and-shoot to keep handy.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use - point and click. Able to be an advanced tool also.
Reviews.Author: J. J. Marino "GeekDomo"
Reviews.Content: My family loves our new Sony DSC-W290. On the surface it can seem very intimidating, but once you use it a while you will see it is a very easy to use camera. From its Carl Zeiss lens to its massive screen you will see this is a quality digital camera. We have taken about 450 photos so far and most of them have been very good. When there is an issue its almost always operator error. If you see many blurry pics you can fix this by turning the top knob to the EASY menu. From that point on I had hardly any blurry shots.Pros:>> Carl Zeiss lens>> Good quality feel>> 12.1 MP>> Easy to point and shootCons:<< Memory stick - come on Sony the world has moved on, give up the ghost already.<< Can take blurry photos if you dont RTFM.<< iffy battery lifeAll in all a fine digital camera to take with you on trips or whatever.Thank you for reading my review.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera.
Reviews.Author: D. Hill
Reviews.Content: The only downside that I have found so far is that you have to take the battery out to charge it.  It comes with this little box that the battery pops into, then that plugs into the wall.  Just a little different.  Also you cannot zoom while you are taking a video. But the ease of use and picture quality are very very easy.  Takes quick pictures in succession, with very clear pics. The image stabilizer seems to work well.  Especially for me.

Reviews.Title: My best camera so far for that price!!
Reviews.Author: Julio C. Montiel "Julio Montiel Silva"
Reviews.Content: Wow, finally i got this excelent camera from SONY. The 5x optical zoom and flash are awesome. All my photos are very clear. My wife was very happy and decided to keep as a christmas present. All was easy friendly to use and in 5 minutes i was taking all my shots with smile and face detection: all happy faces and perfect shots. I am totally convinced of the great quality of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ryan R. Chester "Ry Guy"
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I've ever owned.  It takes amazing pictures and is super easy to use.  The battery last a very long time even when taking multiple HD video shots.  A highly recommended camera for the newer camera buyer.

Reviews.Title: Camera for Hawaii
Reviews.Author: Cheryl A. Opfer
Reviews.Content: The pictues from this camera are awesome.  The only complaint I have - sometimes it doesn't take the time to focus and I get an occasional blurry photo.  It could be me, I want to click quickly, but the quality of the photos are unbelievable.  I use this camera as an additional one since I have a Nikon D300 too. So glad I bought it to take to Hawaii.  It's lightweight and easy to take anywhere.  The 5X zoom comes in handy.  The flower pictures are clear and crisp.

Reviews.Title: So-So
Reviews.Author: Armando Villaneda "Armando"
Reviews.Content: The camera is pretty, but does have a bit of short comings.The camera feels it was created for casual to non-important photos.  During low or indoor lighting there is a lot of noise in the image.  It's auto focus feature also struggles a lot.  On outside, bright, images you don't notice the noise as much until you start to zoom in into the image.The camera works relatively well in outdoor, open events and for the casual shot.  I don't recommend it for indoor use as much.  Color and noise will be a problem.The image stabilization works most of the time, but only when the auto focuses onto something narrow.You'll want to get a second battery just in case because I've experienced 180 shots per charge, and lower when Flash is used.The burst mode is fun, but only when the auto focus centers on a narrow object and not on a wide focus.The buttons are small and not easy to use with one hand.It's hard to keep clean from smudges.

Reviews.Title: Sony Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: THFO "tafkas"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my Sony Cybershot P-8. I have over 9,000 images recorded on it. Two thousand of these were after a piece of lumber fell on it and broke the LCD panel. The P-8 had an optical viewfinder and the camera was still functional. The only drawback about the W-290 is that it has no optical viewfinder. If the LCD panel breaks the camera will be non functional. I did not notice this until I had received it in the mail.The smile shutter works, which amazed me. I don't know how it does it but it does. The blink detector also works as lauded. I also like the bracketing feature.The easy mode should offer more features. It is very limited and offers no customization. With the P-8 I almost never needed to change modes. With the W-290 I find myself using all of the modes in a particular setting. One feature that I might need is only available in "Intelligent" other features are only available in "Program" mode.I like the feel of the camera but I liked the shape and feel of the P-8 better.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: John Paul Jones "John"
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this Sony camera is so easy to use, takes great picture and it costs much less than in the military base. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: SONY 12.1 Mega Pixel
Reviews.Author: Jerry Gordon
Reviews.Content: It is a great camera and glad that I bought it.  It is a little heavier than most point and shoot cameras which is good because it tends to be more stable as a result.  I wish that it had a level somewhere on the camera so that you can be sure that you are shooting correctly.  There were a few times when I thought I was level but was not.  It seems like an easy item to include in the view finder.  I am still learning all its features but so far it has met my needs. It is a small camera that is capable of shooting great photos.  It was also easy to order it through Amazon.

Reviews.Title: great video
Reviews.Author: Bradford T. Leinberger "spartanfan"
Reviews.Content: I got this for the video and It is as good or better than I expected.  The photo quality isn't very good compared to other point and shoot cameras I have had, but I have a nikon d40 and d2x for great quality.  I just like the fact that I can carry around one small camera in my pocket that will take decent photos and will shoot great videos, for that and the low price (i got it at adorama for $219) I think it is an exceptional value.  The videos are so much better than anything I ever shot on a point and shoot before.  The image stabilization helps the video look more professional too.  I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Much Improved Over DSC-W1 (As Expected)
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey A. Hawkins "HumanJHawkins"
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera for it's class. It takes very good photos, is quick to focus and has low shutter lag. It also has all of the features that one finds on these cameras now, including optical image stabilization and an effective auto-smile detection feature. The battery seems to last well, though I didn't pay attention to how many shots I got over how many days.I haven't dropped it, but it seems well built. The LCD display is protected (a little anyway) by a thin layer of glass or Plexiglas. I would purchase this again if a similar need came up.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290
Reviews.Author: Pamela Ford
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent product.  The picture quality is awesome.  My daughter has a W300 and the W290 is just as good.  i would highly recommend this item.

Reviews.Title: blurry & grainy pictures
Reviews.Author: Dan D.
Reviews.Content: This camera took blurry & grainy pictures indoors. compared to my old cannon S60 the quality is not good at all.All the rest is very good:The video is quality fantastic and the outdoors pictures are good.The interface and menus are easy to work with.I don't know if I got a lemon or if this is the standard quality. I returned this unit and will buy the cannon SD780.shame - wanted the wide angle view and the big zoom :-(Thank you amazon for a great costumer service experience.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Clawson "Mom of 2"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera! It knows what I want before I want it. Takes great close-ups, landscapes and everything in between.

Reviews.Title: dsc-w290
Reviews.Author: Cam Era
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera. The features are fun and very useable.  The large screen is clear and easy to see in the sunlight.  I love it.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, with good features
Reviews.Author: C. A. Dreyfus
Reviews.Content: Everything is awesome, the only feature missing is zoom capabilities while filming, you have to stop to move the zoom in and out.For everything else is the best camera I have owned.

Reviews.Title: I returned this camera.
Reviews.Author: Joanne C. "Dog Lover"
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon A540 that ran on AA batteries, which I didn't like. However, until recently the photos on the Canon were very nice, colorful and crisp. Recently, the flash stopped working, so I went looking for another camera. I really wanted to like the Sony camera, because we are extremely happy with our Sony HDTV. However, after spending a couple of days taking indoor photos and photos in cloudy dark weather, I discovered that the photos look soft or fuzzy under those conditions, when compared to the old Canon I had (when it was working properly.) Also, it didn't do well with moving pets, children, etc. It is a very easy camera to use and I liked the larger viewing window, but I was only happy with the photos taken in sunny light outdoors.  I exchanged it for the Canon SD1200IS and took photos of pets, indoors and in the dark cloudy weather yesterday. All of the photos came out much crisper, clearer and with truer color that with the Sony.  I think the Sony is an OK camera, but I wasn't happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: W. Uncapher
Reviews.Content: The Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-W290 is one awesome camera. It's one of the coolest, most modern looking cameras in it's price range! It takes outstanding high quality photos everytime. The photos are vivid, sharp and clear! With excellant true-to-life color! The Auto Intelligent mode takes all the guess work out of taking great photos! Just aim and shoot, the camera does the rest! Perfect photos everytime! The 720p HD video recording is also excellant. You can save and make great still photos from your recorded video. You can't tell the difference from regular photos! The Sony menu navigation is the easiest and best in the industry. Something I understand Sony worked very hard on improving in their new camera line-up, such as the DSC-W290! The Sony DSC-W290 is very well built, solid and sturdy. As with all Sony products! Plus it has professional Carl Zeiss German lenses, the same brand used by NASA on the Space Shuttle! The Sony DSC-W290 is very hard to beat in it's price range! Buy one! I'm sure you'll agree! The Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-W290 is one excellant camera, that's very, very hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: J. R. "jack1963"
Reviews.Content: This camera replaced an older Cyber-shot.  I checked out lots of other sites and reviews of cameras before purchasing this one.  And I am glad I did. It takes excellent photos, and is lightweight/small enough to carry in a pocket.  Love the bronze color too!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, but...
Reviews.Author: Dellywhere
Reviews.Content: I tried this camera for a very specific purpose:  The HD video quality had to greatly exceed that of my Fujifilm F10's VGA video quality.  In a head-to-head comparison, it flunked.  The resolution at 720 Fine was not quite as sharp as the F10, and the autofocus searched excessively.  The macro function is also not as good as the F10, losing focus at about twice the distance from the subject.  For someone less fussy, who doesn't already own an F10, it might be a fine choice.  My F10 is 5 years old or so.  I hope we don't have to wait too much longer for truly crisp HD in a point and shoot.  The limitation might be the compression.  It's in motion video that the new Sony seems to lose out.

Reviews.Title: Very poor camera
Reviews.Author: Bernardo Queiroz "Beradesign"
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for.Although the description tells of a very nice camera (12MP, 3" screen, 5x zoom, hd video...) the picture quality is VERY POOR.I regret having bought it.

Reviews.Title: The camera is Good.....But
Reviews.Author: Mother Goose "WI Grandma"
Reviews.Content: The Camera is good but arrived with a Europeon charger which will not work here in the US.  It was also missing a memory card.  We did some scrambling to find parts to adjust to make it work.  ...not pleased.

Reviews.Title: Oldie But Goodie
Reviews.Author: KeraC
Reviews.Content: Did not realize that I never gave a review for this camera. Had purchased this back in 2009 when smartphones weren't as smart when it came to pics/videos, and by today's standards, this item is obsolete. 12.1 MP is below standard on high-end Androids, 5X zoom (especially one as blurry as on this camera) is a joke, and many devices now can zoom during filming and capture fast-action shots with ease. The W290 despite being in the compact category is still quite bulky, and so very few people probably still use theirs.I'm one of those few. It still works well going on 5 years (recently used it during travel and didn't have to worry about draining my phone battery), and it has many of the lighting/editing options found on your average smartphone. The SD card can be easily inserted into a reader, and media is transferred with ease, and without using the corded attachments included with the camera.The Sony Cyber-Shot may be a relic, but it's a working relic, so i don't see myself being rid of it anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Niels Bogh
Reviews.Content: Does what it is advertized to do and is a great little work camera. Fits in a breast pocket and can get into tight spaces for documentation.

Reviews.Title: Clarity of the pictures is GREATLove the Camera- Love it- but not so great that is came with a battery charger that I cannot use
Reviews.Author: Rehana Steadman
Reviews.Content: Love the camera!!!  I had this same camera 4 yrs ago and loved the clarity of the pictures!Bought another sony camera and used it for 2 yrs hated it...then I went back to my old love.I am NOT HAPPY with the fact that this came with a Euro style charger...The description said it MAY come with one...but, all the other reviews said it DID come with the Euro chargerI wish the seller would be up front and just say YES, this comes with a EURO CHARGER, that way at the same time of purchase I could add a normal charger to my cart.

Reviews.Title: Zoom no longer works.
Reviews.Author: Chris. C
Reviews.Content: I have owned several digital cameras and they all performed well to the point I upgraded to a newer one.  This is the first one that malfunctioned in my hand (I have had each for about 2 years). It does take great pictures with crystal clear images and vibrant colors but one day it refused to focus when zooming in.  Pictures taken without the zoom still comes out great. It's really a waste that I have to give up this great camera because of the zoom problem.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290 12.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Ruby Green
Reviews.Content: Fast shipping & good packaging.  Great camera have the same camera, purchased when they first came out.  User friendly & takes great pictures. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amy Lee
Reviews.Content: I have owned a previous Sony Cybershot, and I liked it so much that I wanted another when I lost my old one. This new Cybershot also takes great pictures (for a point at shoot camera). The only criticism that I have is that transitions of turning the camera on and off or viewing the picture and taking picture mode are a little slow. Also, the wheel to change the picture to movie mode is easily moved, so just taking the camera out of its case can change this selection. Otherwise, I a very pleased with this camera's performance!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this trash
Reviews.Author: Meral Shamoiani
Reviews.Content: This cam is the worst ever Sony product. Did not work from beginning. Did not save pics to sd card. Had very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: European camera?
Reviews.Author: jivie
Reviews.Content: Came with a European adapter and not with a US power cord which would have only cost a few cents to include.  The memory slot is for Sony memory card and is NOT SD like every other camera in the world.A big surprise when opened on Christmas morning.

Reviews.Title: Came with a charger for the UK.
Reviews.Author: Dr. Gonzo
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little camera. It's simple to use and takes much better pictures than my older sony. The only problem is that it comes with a charger for the United Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-W290 Review
Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: The charger that came with the camera is for European use.  Fortunately we had a charger that is 120/60 VAC use.  If not for that it would have been 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Cam
Reviews.Author: Mr. Parks
Reviews.Content: Soon as I got it I saw it cheaper on the same site. But as the product itself pretty good!

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290 12 MP Digital Camera w/5x Optical Zoom
Reviews.Author: Dale Woods
Reviews.Content: It was a discontinued model that had the upgraded lens that I was looking for so, I bought it. It meets my expectations quite well.

Reviews.Title: An excellent P&S; camera for indoor shoots, and closest to an SLR for outdoor shoots
Reviews.Author: Antimony "Antimony"
Reviews.Content: Writing this review after using this camera for more than 3 years now.PROS:1) I bought this camera for taking pictures for my Swiss trip. I am a student, so I needed something cheap (When I bought, this camera costed me $228.46. Couldn't afford an SLR!), but yet something that would capture the beauty of Switzerland. I have made three Europe trips so far and I must say I don't regret buying this camera at all.2) It has got multiple settings for choosing image size, which means if I'm short on memory on the SD card, I don't need to delete photos. I just change the photo resolution. Of course, it will affect the quality, but at least I'm glad I have the option.3) The zoom is perfect not just for landscape images, but also on the macro setting. Of course, since it's not an SLR it doesn't have a wide-angle lens. But I generally just put it in the burst mode and capture the whole landscape in a panoramic fashion. It works for me!4) MOST LOVED FEATURE: I like the iAuto mode. It feels like it actually has a brain of it's own!! I am not a pro at photography, but by putting it in the Auto mode, the camera can capture dual images. The first one is usually how it looks (as it is, probably with bad lighting and all), whereas the second image is adjusted for lighting by the camera itself! It's really helpful! Plus it can auto detect if it's taking macro images, or there is backlight, or even if your hands are not steady (SteadyShot image stabilization feature)!!5) This is probably the only P&S; that takes brilliant indoor pictures (even in dim lighting), mostly due to the iAuto mode. I've tried several canons and kodaks. But this is the only camera which hasn't disappointed me at all!CONS:1) It is NOT an SLR!! :( I've compared identical images taken by my friend's SLR and my camera, and the difference is noticeable. That does not necessarily mean that my image is bad, but there's no way a P&S; can compete with an SLR.2) The LCD screen is really nice and shows you a great picture! However when you transfer this pic onto your PC, it looks like the PC wiped out all the colours and shine that you saw on the LCD. But if I see the same pic on my iPad, then again it looks nice and colourful. I know this is a problem with the screen resolution of my PC, but nonetheless, before I could figure this out, I used to get very disappointed with my camera after transferring the image to my PC. In short, the LCD does not give you a real feeling of how your image is going to look on your PC.

Reviews.Title: sony cyber-shot dsc-w290
Reviews.Author: P. Boycie Javier "boycie javier"
Reviews.Content: purchased this product for my wife, sometime back. took over 3000 perfect (i think) pictures). had to buy additional batteries. i highly recommend this camera for those who just want to document vacations, grand kids, etc.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing, but decent
Reviews.Author: meninamoca
Reviews.Content: When I first received my Cybershot, I was so excited because I had previously owned the same model before it had been stolen and knew that it took quality pictures.Now, don't get me wrong, the camera still took quality pictures, however the functionality of the camera was a little diminished (after all, it was used).Long story short, the "Menu" button does not work and with that minor setback came many other setbacks, including changing the frame of the shot, the color (i.e. b&w;, sepia, etc), and many other important features. Furthermore because the "Menu" button doesn't work, when I play back my photos, I am unable to delete pictures directly from the camera and thus can only edit photos out after having transferred it onto my computer.This overlooked and unmentioned detail that the seller failed to disclose really took away from the overall quality of the camera. All-in-all, the comfort of knowing that this camera took quality pictures fell a bit short after learning the convenience of the camera wasn't actually so convenient; still, the camera is a great investment.

Reviews.Title: slow shutter speed and blurry pics
Reviews.Author: KLM1976
Reviews.Content: This is not your camera if you want to take a picture of anything slightly moving. I try to get a shot of my 2 year old son and it does not work. There is also no feature to turn the flash on. It is either auto or off. The Auto does not work well and takes pictures often when you need a flash. I have had this camera now for 2 years and have been disappointed with it. Try a cannon instead.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for any occasion!
Reviews.Author: cnjsting "cnjsting"
Reviews.Content: Great camera! We love the features with this Sony digital camera. The picture quality has surpassed our expectations, and the video features have been perfect. We have used the video aspect to capture whale watching trips, weddings, trips to Disneyland, and just when we want to have access to great memories shared with family and friends. This camera is compact. Downloading pictures has been fast and easy. I would not hesitate to buy another Sony of the same model. Easily 9 out of 10 stars.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever backed by a BIG name
Reviews.Author: RB "RB"
Reviews.Content: Curse myself for not returning it back within the 30-day period. Worst camera I ever used. Blurry pics, horrible under low lights. Don't waste your money. Sony lcd quality is exceptional, better than most. But picture quality sucks. Can't zoom in during movie mode. Never ever buy this.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre camera
Reviews.Author: AAKM
Reviews.Content: I needed a replacement for my old Sony camera and after extensive research, bought the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290. The camera is nicely built with easy to use controls. Initially, the pictures came out good, however I did notice a change from the old Sony. The main drawback with this camera is indoor or low light photography. When taking pictures inside the house or at parties, the colors as well as focus is off. Outdoors, the camera is passable, however the sharpness can be hit or miss.The reason for the 2 stars is that approximately 6 months after we bought the camera, the lens cover stopped opening fully. That meant that every time we took a picture, we had to manually open the cover, or else the picture would be cropped. This was past the warranty period, so I was stuck with a defective camera.After reading  Ken Rockwell's website, I bought the more expensive Canon S95. The difference between both cameras is day and night!Pro's:- Small, compact with easy controls.- Decent battery lifeCon's:- Poor indoor/low light results- Mediocre video- Prone to breaking downIn summary: If you would like to capture cherished memories of your family, I would not recommend this camera. There are much better choices.

Reviews.Title: omg... Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290!
Reviews.Author: omGARY
Reviews.Content: Purchased this back in Oct 2009 -- and it's still functioning like a champ. There's a lot of functions on this camera, which are pretty useless to me since I can just edit my photos in Picasa.Only thing I wish this camera could do is take pictures of very close-up items, like say, a ladybug or something. Or maybe you can, and I just haven't figured out how. One other things that would be nice are to have a zoom function in video mode, and to be slimmer. There wasn't much difference, if any, in thickness between this and the much older cyber-shots.Also take care from dropping this camera. I don't think they're built to take much shock. My old cyber-shot died because of this after dropping it three times on concrete from waist height.But yeah, good camera!

Reviews.Title: BUENO
Reviews.Author: ELISANI CARABALLO
Reviews.Content: BUENO..PERO A ESTE PROVEEDOR NO LE PUDE HACER SEGUIMIENTO ..DE RESTO LO RECOMIENDO, EL PRODUCTO LLEGO RAPIDO Y EN BUENAS CONDICIONES

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: hnguyen
Reviews.Content: The item is okay. There are some scratches on it but the quality is very good. For half of the original price, this item is worth.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera!
Reviews.Author: MommaJBeans
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera over 2 years ago and have just reached over 10,000 photos taken. I primarily have it set on the automatic setting, and this camera delivers excellent quality pictures on nearly every shot. While other cameras tend to have significant blurring when the subject moves at all, this CyberShot manages a crisp image almost every time...avoiding missed shots and frustration when trying to capture the activities of a small child! Unfortunately the camera has recently met it's demise when it was dropped on the ground, but I will have no problems deciding which camera to purchase as a replacement - definitely buying another of this model! Love, love love it :)

Reviews.Title: Battery issues
Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: I would think this was a nice easy camera for a point and shot person like me except I can not get this camera to hold a battery charge.  I have purchased three new batteries in the less than 2 years I have had this unit.  One Sony and the other two off brands.  Plus this camera has been sent in under warranty for this issue.  It did work a bit better for a short time after it was returned (it was gone for about 4 weeks).  Now none of the batteries will last more than a week in this unit and two only for a day.  Four batteries in less than two years is just not acceptable.  They have been fully charged each time before I use them.  I do not take a lot of pictures so this is not a heavy use camera.  I am ready to toss this and not buy a Sony replacement.  My old Cannon takes regular batteries and every time I have to reach for it this camera is ready to go.

Reviews.Title: Sony camera
Reviews.Author: ERose
Reviews.Content: Really enjoy this camera. Easy to use and takes great pictures. Sometime the flash is a little too strong so often just shut it off. Red eye works well. Smile function is a bit superfluous, but whatever- entertaining to use.

Reviews.Title: Very Unhappy!!! Poor quality
Reviews.Author: ja61impala
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera thinking it would be great to get pictures of my daughter as she grows. Well the only problem is that is really hard to do if it is either not working properly or it is in service!!! Very frustrating. Is always seems to have the same problem, When i first got it the pics were great for at least a few days. What mine camera does is the anti-shake light comes on no matter if I am holding it or it is sitting on a counter, well any slight movement pics turn out fuzzy. In the beginning it worked pretty good i was happy. not all i have is blurry kid pics. Now im stuck with a non working camera for a third time and they told me they wanted 170.00 to fix it Wow that's a ton considering what i paid for it, Why not just buy a new camera which is what im looking to do now. SO in shirt really think about it before you buy one..

Reviews.Title: Afghanistan rough and still going strong after 1 year in the sand
Reviews.Author: G. Boatner "SSG B"
Reviews.Content: I have to hand it to Sony.  This camera is hands down the best compact Cam I have ever owned.  The battery life is awesome.  The best pics, with the easiest use on any cam on the run I have ever had the chance to use.  It is extremely tough, 1 year in the sands of Afghanistan and its still works perfect.  I love this cam.  The video option works in low light, sunlight, any time I need it.  Buy it you will not be disappointed I promise.A Scout Trooper

Reviews.Title: Great Amazing Digital Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Henrry "Henrry"
Reviews.Content: I'm very proud to said that this is one of my best buys of all time, this cameras has a really nice resolution so in pictures and video, the stabilization option it has great, the optical zoom take pictures very closely from objects in long distances respect than others.I recommend to buy this digital camera, it has great and easy to use it.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera Loaded With Features
Reviews.Author: John Wilcox "Family Man"
Reviews.Content: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290 12 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and Super Steady Shot Image Stabilization (Blue)When I broke my last camera (also a Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290) while I was on vacation, I replaced it with another Sony DSC-W290.  I had the first one over a year before I stupidly stuffed it in the pocket of my cargo shorts and jumped on the wild and crazy Simpsons ride at Universal Studios, in Florida.  As Bart says, "Eat my shorts..." and that's what the camera did.  Had the DSC-W290 been equipped with a view finder to supplement its sizable color display, I would still be using my old W290.  But, alas, there is no such view finder on the W290, and when the display shattered I was operating in the blind.  Other than that the W290 has everything I want in a snapshot-style camera.There are a few things you should do if you plan to purchase the W290:  (1) Buy at least one Sony Memory Stick PRO Duo Magic Gate Mark 2 that holds at least 2GB (I have a 2GB and a 4GB as a backup); (2) Purchase a Sony carrying case that is compact enough to fit on your belt, but has a storage pocket large enough to hold a spare memory stick and a spare battery; it's much safer than your pants pocket; (3) Buy a Sony NP-FG1 Lithium battery; the camera comes with a Sony NP-BG1, but the NP-FG1 displays the minutes of battery life remaining before a recharge is necessary; (4) Don't carry the camera in your pants pocket unless you want to hear your wife express her opinion of your I.Q. and/or you plan to purchase a new camera shortly thereafter; (5) If you do plan to carry the camera in your pants pocket, you might want to buy accidental damage insurance for it, along with a set of wife-resistant earplugs.  My replacement W290 is fully covered through a three-year Square Trade Warranty.  Sony guarantees the W290 for the first year, but not against accidental damage or stupidity.  You can find Square Trade Warranty on Amazon, at http://www.amazon.com/SquareTrade-Camcorder-Warranty-Accident-Protection/dp/B002I03UQG/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid;=1293929931&sr;=8-1.  It's well worth the $39.99! Or, buy directly from Square Trade Warranty and you might find a better bargain.The W290 has been around for awhile, but the price keeps going up while most of its counterparts are going down faster than the Simpsons ride at Universal Studios.  That's likely because Sony has packed this little gem with a bunch of quality features and it works like a charm.Finally, if you want a camera that allows you to take a snapshot with the touch of one button, or if you want to play with the settings, this is the camera you're looking for.  Our now seven-year-old has been taking beautiful pictures with the W290 since she was six, while I like changing the camera settings.  Either way, the pictures come out great.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after 6 months
Reviews.Author: a mom
Reviews.Content: Thought I would stop by and write a review while shopping for a new camera. This stopped working after 6 months. Bummer.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Michelle Verville "flowrgirl1"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a year and a half now and really love it.  It gets lots of use and not a single problem so far.  I do wish it could zoom while recording but that is a minor flaw.  It takes beautiful shots on the smart setting which is what I mostly use to capture quick shots.  The HD video is really nice even up on the big screen.It's a great quility camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Helt
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and then I thought I screwed it up, but I went and redid what screwed it up in the first place, I fixed it and now it is still a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Another great Cybershot
Reviews.Author: Hpu2000
Reviews.Content: I had a Cybershot DSC W150 that I dropped and broke.  Bought this as a replacement and am very pleased.  It is very easy to use and if you're mostly a "set it on automatic" kind of user, it is great.  The only issue is darkness in low light, but this has been improved with this camera and I've found this to be an issue in almost any small point and shoot.  Of course, just turning on some lights helps the situation ; )  I also love that the battery lasts so long on one charge.  Definitely enough for a whole weekend on one charge.  Great little camera overall that makes it easy to get good pictures without any effort on your part.

Reviews.Title: No problems
Reviews.Author: Steven Kates
Reviews.Content: My second Sony Cyber-shot; I liked the 1st so much that, after I dropped it for the last time, I stepped up to this newer model.  So far, nothing but satisfaction for the quality of image, the hi-def video and clear sound.  It's winner for all my basic media needs.

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: mdoher "gasoftware"
Reviews.Content: I'm pleased with the camera. It produces some nice results and I cannot fault it overall.I bought it as a cheap point and shoot camera to slip into a pocket and not worry if it gets damaged or lost and produces good quality shots that I can use. For that purpose it ticks all the boxes.Fast delivery and so far trouble free snapping!

Reviews.Title: Great camera when it WORKS :(
Reviews.Author: Pam Nicely
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for a Christmas gift last year and I loved it at first.  It took come great pictures and the zoom was awesome.  However, my love was short-lived.  In the short 7 months that I have owned it, it has gone to the Sony repair center TWICE.  It just refuses to open...tells me to turn off and back on...etc.  I've removed the battery numerous times.  No go.  The lens stays put.  By the looks of the other reviews, I probably just got a lemon.  However, be warned.  When it works, it's very very good.  But when it doesn't....  You'll get very very frustrated.  Once this camera is out of the warranty period, if it breaks again, it's going in the trash and I'll be searching for a new camera.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for my daughter after reading a number of reviews and was very pleasantly surprised. I have had a number of digital cameras starting with the early generations to the digital SLR ones with the replaceable lenses and this matches or exceeds almost all of them (the DSLR is a little better on action shots).  The video quality is so amazing that we have stopped using our video camera and use this almost exclusively.  The audio quality with the built-in mike is pretty good.  We recorded our daughters concert and the audio was pretty decent (video was amazing).Have had this camera for about six months and it has survived a trip to Disney World, Graduation and Prom and a number of concerts and games.  Two things to look out for:1.  The camera is not the thinnest/smallest in its category.  Although not large, it is about the thickness of two iPhones, a little large to stick in your pocket but pretty easy to carry in a bag or pouch.2. You can NOT zoom in or out while recording a video.  Has not been a major issue for us, but could be a an issue.  I just stop recording, zoom and start recording.Even with those two minor issues my daughter absolutely loves it.

Reviews.Title: Get this camera
Reviews.Author: Lee West
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my wife who wants it simple and has had a problem with dropping and loosing cameras. I did not want to spend too much for those reasons. I spent $170 for the basic camera. I was so impressed with the picture quality and ease of use that I bought myself a used one for $140. The lens is excellent and the setting are more than sufficient for a small camera. And who needs more than 12 MPs anyway? Who really needs even that many? I like this camera. It is mostly about the lens.

Reviews.Title: Excellent wide lens. Superb video quality.
Reviews.Author: Wes
