Reviews.Content: While not a perfect camera, it definitely has strengths. I love the wide lens and the huge field you're able to capture. Fully zoomed out, it takes excellent pictures in bright, outdoor light. It suffers a bit in low light and when utilizing the digital zoom - that's where it could use improvement.When shooting video, it is downright film-like. This camera has exceptional video quality. Unfortunately, you cannot zoom at all once you begin recording. Also, it only records audio in mono.Other than that, the LCD display is excellent and the controls are easy to use (though it might be an issue with people with huge fingers).I also like that this Sony camera gives you the option of B & W / Sepia color modes - something their newer models do NOT feature at all.I'm so pleased overall with this camera that I bought another one to keep in case my first goes faulty (which it hasn't yet!).

Reviews.Title: nice for the money
Reviews.Author: Patti Pitney
Reviews.Content: The colors are brilliant! We went to Alaska and I took over 1500 pix and movies. Alaska offers a full range of overcast, cloudy and sunny full light days. The little W290 did well. I bought an 8G and 4G strip and used up about 20 g or more...but transferred it to a laptop to keep it managable. I never even pulled the 4G strip out! BTW...the 4G strip was only $12 on Amazon. Imagine a roll of film holding 350 shots reusable for $12! The HD video mode allows for 30 min/2G of memory.To me a 4 star is perfect. Nothing probably deserves a 5 STAR so that's why I gave it a 4. It is a well engineered, well thought out highly technical camera but EASY to use. You don't need to even hardly read the manual. Just keep an extra battery and memory strip...as with all cameras. You will love it so much you will USE this one! Good luck!Secondly, I've had many cameras in my life including 35mm 'old' film styles. I have 3 Sony digitals and each one was 'ahead of it's time' technically. This one is no different. I'm not a photo affecionado but know good pictures when I see them. I opted for small size to throw in my front pants pocket rather than a bulky larger more powerful camera. But I too was surprised. This is one powerful camera! Every feature of this camera is great. The high resolution allows photo editing to crop and enlarge great pictures. The BURST mode allows for fast action multiple pix. The stabilization software appears to work great, almost completely eliminating the unstable 'hand'. The HD video movie mode is wonderful but even though the stabilization software is great be careful when 'zoomed in' and taking video. It will shake! Better than no stabilization but it does shake.Most of the neghatives reported by others seem to be true...but probably for a reason. The small buttons keep you from turning it on/off or taking pixs while it's in the pocket along other small items like keys etc. Smile detection is for babies and kids and works very well. You need 4-5 feet focal point minimum for it to work but it does and pretty well. Those that think it's useless never took pix of kids before.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: I like this camera because the ease of use and the video is shot at 720p.  But to connect the camera to any hdmi device you need to order another special wire from sony for the camera. Typical for sony wouldn't you say.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use! Great quality for money!
Reviews.Author: David A. Crabb
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It's priced right for our budget with high performance. My dad and nephew have the same camera and really like theirs so I thought I'd get one too and have not been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Walk on by
Reviews.Author: Cab5s
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after owning several Kodak cameras over the past ten years.  It has been awful as far as I'm concerned.  It is much slower than my Kodak cameras and the picture quality is not as good.  The final straw was that the battery cover just broke after only 7 months of careful use and according to Sony's website, I have to pay to ship the item to them for them to fix it.  I'm a big fan of Sony's camcorders, but this will definitely be the last still camera I buy from them.

Reviews.Title: For a novice, this camera has been great!!
Reviews.Author: Cj Cavanaugh
Reviews.Content: I haven't had the camera long, but so far I have been very happy w/all the features and the ease of use.  I am not super technical so having this camera working so well for me has been great-  it is a very nice camera.  And several of my friends have commented that their more expensive camera's do not perform as well.  Very happy.

Reviews.Title: SONY as always :):)
Reviews.Author: LV Digi :)
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. Easy to use,  it would be better if the battery lasted longer.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable, Poor Video Quality, and Expensive Memory
Reviews.Author: Daniel Berntson
Reviews.Content: I've had a Sony DSC-290 for just about a year--I bought the camera for a trip to Europe last summer with my dad.  The camera LCD stopped function in the middle of our trip (fortunately, we had brought along a spare).  Video records with a purple vertical line whenever there strong light in the picture.  I sent the camera back for repairs and got it back last fall.  Since then, the zoom has stopped working and I have to send it back again.  I've been trying to send it back, but the Sony repair site hasn't been working.  Also, note that this camera uses Sony's proprietary memory sticks instead of the standard SD cards.  That would be fine, except for the fact that memory sticks are about twice as expensive for the same amount of memory.All in all, I have not been very happy with this camera and will not be buying a Sony next time.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I love the Sony line of digital point and shoot camera's. We just replaced our older Sony Cyber Shot DSC-S500 6.0 megapixel camera that we've had for years. I'm amazed at all the advanced features like the optical steady shot, all the different formats, the smile detector, burst mode (it takes several shots per second), and on and on. The picture clarity is amazing as well as the video clarity. I wish they had kept the original AA battery design, but I just purchased a spare battery from Amazon that I keep charged and with me everywhere we go. I also upgraded the memory to 4 Gig and can't believe how many pics this camera will hold! We just got back from a trip to the Carribean and took over 640 pics and 4 video's and still had 135 pics to go. Battery life so far has been great, but I would suggest to everyone to completely drain your battery prior to charging it for the first time. This is a several day process but it well worth it. Just leave the camera on in video mode until it dies. Then just keep turning it on until it stops turning on after several hours of rest. My next camera will be a Sony, but I'm sure that won't be for many years to come since these camera's are durable and reliable. Happy Shooting!

Reviews.Title: A Camera that you can count on.
Reviews.Author: Sharaf E. Mohammed
Reviews.Content: I deffintely like it. It is easy to use with a great quality of pictures. An item that you can use for official and personal memories.

Reviews.Title: price, portability, quality.
Reviews.Author: rynmrrs
Reviews.Content: great quality weight, so far very durable. buttons are somewhat small, but work for my hands (has an easy function for simplicity!)love the quality of pictures and user-friendliness. a huge plus is the HD video capability... great asset. this camera is compatible with my Mac OS X, macbook, and loads easily into i-photo etc. definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: ilikered "ilikered"
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these for a very nice price. And i have been using lot of Sony products and i just love them. This camera is also very good. For the price i got this for, it is really worth.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera with Great Quality Photos!
Reviews.Author: T. Heeg
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera a month ago & have used it a lot since we had a baby since then. I LOVE IT! We have had 2 other Sony Cybershot Cameras that are older models & this is by far the best one. We liked the other which is why I knew I would most likely love this one. One of the best qualities I love is that you can take bright pictures even in the dark with no flash! Perfect for a newborn. The only thing I don't like is that the picture doesn't turn depending on which way you are holding the camera when viewing it...but that is not a big deal. One photographer even saw it and wanted to get one.  I would Highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great for those who are not great with a camera!
Reviews.Author: bffhusker "bffhusker"
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with the ease and picture quality of this camera. I was glad I researched and found my findings to be exactly what this camera delivered. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Just want a picture, buy it!
Reviews.Author: Saif AL-Khuraisat
Reviews.Content: This camera is good for who want just a picture that he/she not going to print in the wall! IAuto mode is great choice and dual shooting as option is great one two. When I compare this Sony W290 with Nikon coolpix that I have, Nikon when in terms of picture quality and purity. In terms of battery Sony wins. But what about ease of use? Sony wins also because my Nikon was not built for shaky hands people, where Sony is well-know for shoot-as-you-go concept.Nikon picture quality is better than Sony but I got this as when I want take a picture for myself I will use someone help but that person could have a shaky hand which will result in bad picture quality and here Sony comes to save you. Without this option in Sony I would still use only Nikon. Of course I do use both now; I would not give up Nikon which is made for professional people.

Reviews.Title: Nice for who want just a picture!
Reviews.Author: Saif AL-Khuraisat
Reviews.Content: This camera is good for who want just a picture that he/she not going to print in the wall! IAuto mode is great choice and dual shooting as option is great one two. When I compare this Sony W290 with Nikon coolpix that I have, Nikon when in terms of picture quality and purity. In terms of battery Sony wins. But what about ease of use? Sony wins also because my Nikon was not built for shaky hands people, where Sony is well-know for shoot-as-you-go concept.Nikon picture quality is better than Sony but I got this as when I want take a picture for myself I will use someone help but that person could have a shaky hand which will result in bad picture quality and here Sony comes to save you. Without this option in Sony I would still use only Nikon. Of course I do use both now; I would not give up Nikon which is made for professional people.

Reviews.Title: Impossible to get a clear picture
Reviews.Author: ColetteRenee
Reviews.Content: I am a moderate camera user and tend to take all the pics for events and group outings for everyone to go and grab off my facebook page, so it's important that I have an easy, no fuss camera that can smoothly handle and deal with moving objects. This camera is lightweight and does turn on fairly quickly. The display screen is a nice size for viewing and the setting options are easy to read, navigate and understand. It also has really great features and functionality, if the whole thing would work properly. No matter what setting I have selected for a picture if the object moves even slightly (I'm talking about not even breathing for the picture!), or your hand shakes even a little bit, the pictures all come out blurry and fuzzy. I'm not sure if the camera I have is defected or what, but compared to my previous Fuji Finepix camera, this one overall is just very frustrating. Unfortunately, I used this camera to take pictures of my evening wedding and barely got any decent pictures as it doesn't seem to do well in low-light, even though there is a specific setting for it. Depending on what setting and size of pics that I pre-selected on the camera, I also had a very difficult time resizing pictures to put into an online photo album creator (it's as if the pics were stuck to their size). Im very disappointed because I read extensive reviews and did my research before getting the Sony Cybershot and had anticipated receiving a great camera that was lighter in weight than the Fuji Finepix and a sure way to take great pics of my family/friends, my dog and vacation experiences...but it sadly just didn't happen.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: P. Roche "Paul Roche III"
Reviews.Content: So far I am very happy with the camera.It takes very nice pictures with ease.

Reviews.Title: Gift for my sister
Reviews.Author: P. Michaels
Reviews.Content: This was a gift that was given to my 21 year old sister for your bday.  She really loves the camera.  Also, two of wife's sisters received this camera for christmas 2009.  They both really like the camera as well.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Terri M. Neumann
Reviews.Content: I love the camera!!!  Super easy to use, great picture quality, and looks sharp!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera.  Love it
Reviews.Author: David DeWeese
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my girlfriend, and now wish I had one.  Great point and shoot camera

Reviews.Title: loving it
Reviews.Author: Syed Haq "simple-tech"
Reviews.Content: cons: thick  memory chip (has to be sony and $$$ go to ebay)pros: great pics  easy to use  great videos

Reviews.Title: After a year, I still like this camera
Reviews.Author: Amy in Michigan
Reviews.Content: This review is for the totally non-technical person.  I have no idea what I'm talking about when it comes to specifications, so I'll write from that viewpoint.I've had this camera for almost a year, and it has been my sole camera on several vacations and family events.  Some friends were having a very tiny private wedding and asked me to take informal pictures before, and this is the camera I used.  Overall, I'm pretty happy with it.Pros:  Small  Lightweight  Clear photos  Minimal shutter delay  Cropped and blown up photos are still clear  Battery holds a charge for a good length of time.Cons:  Low profile buttons on top of camera are TOO low.  Cost of Sony memory cards and extra battery!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: B. C. Hobert "hoberts"
Reviews.Content: We have only had our camera for one month but so far we love it.  It takes great pictures and it is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: no good pict quality
Reviews.Author: D. Sutariya "Dhruv"
Reviews.Content: hii had canon 650 before, i broght this - did not like pic quality, some more technical difficulty, return it to store

Reviews.Title: SONY W-290
Reviews.Author: IGS "amateur photographer"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my new camera. I already had a SONY mid-size, which I love, so this one was easy to learn how to use. Very similar. I liked that it uses the same battery and memory stick,so they are interchangeable. Disappointed that the cord is not the same; it is something extra for me to take on trips. I love it for sharp close ups. It even does well for distance shots that I then crop. Of course, the blue color is great. I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants to be able to slip the camera in his/her pocket and take very clear pictures.The price was fair as well.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as older Sony
Reviews.Author: James Yekrang "Jamshid"
Reviews.Content: This is perhaps my 10th Sony Cybershot and possibly the worst. Even though it's a 12mp the quality is not that good. Many blury shots even on auto. The flash is too strong at times and make the image very bright. Anyways, I like Sony Digital Camers but this is not one that I would recomment

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: A. Culp
Reviews.Content: I bought this more expensive camera hoping its quality would be better then the canon I tried about a week or two before but it ends up actually being worse.  Pixelation occurs on almost all pictures on the LCD and when you upload it to your computer.  My much older casio (6mp from around 2004) still took better pictures then this camera.  It also doesn't take what I thought was a standard memory card size

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: eil
Reviews.Content: The print color is awesome.  Not too impressed with the video color reproduction.  Am still studying the manual though.  Thanks Sony.

Reviews.Title: So far we love it!
Reviews.Author: Dianna
Reviews.Content: We've had it for a little less than a month and so far we love it.  Easy to use. Takes great pictures.  What is there not to love?

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: C. Gilman "Gilroy79"
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this camera.  Easy to use and very good picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Loving This Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Ferguson "ferg husker"
Reviews.Content: Previous to this Sony we had two Nikon's. Both were OK but for the price and service from Amazon this Sony is simply a lovely piece of technology. You would not consider me a photo buff so I do not need to be able to make all of the lense, film speed and shutter adjustments. This camera takes care of most of these tasks producing excellent photo results. You can make just enough tweeks to get the desired result. For example turn off the flash and this camera adjusts the shutter speed to produce perfect available light photos. Unless you are really moving when shoting photos this camera simply eliminates problems with your unintended camera movement. I installed an 8 gig. card so with the 12 meg. max photo size there is plenty of capacity. The action video mode works great and the 8 gig. card provides plenty of recording time. Love the wide angle lense and the 3" screen. Uploading and storing photos using Windows Vista is very easy. Bought the Sony camera case so that we could keep the lcd screen and camera from getting scratched while being carried or in a purse.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cybershot for Christmas
Reviews.Author: Joy Morgan "GioiaAlicia"
Reviews.Content: Pretty good little camera.  The video feature is cool, that's the reason for the purchase. Although the zoom is not that far.  After I purchased this camera from Amazon, I found it cheaper at Best Buy.  Also, I could've taken it back and exchanged for the color my daughter really wanted if I had purchased from Best Buy. Anyway, it takes great pics and serves it purpose. I would purchase it again. It's the best buy for what we were looking for.Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and Super Steady Shot Image Stabilization (Blue)

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Daniel Mora
Reviews.Content: This is my first camera and really have much expectation about making a good investment. And what can I say, I am very happy that I had chosen this camera, its image quality is very good and if you use the 12-megapixel photos will have an excellent presentation on the details, the video is very good can see very clearly and sharpness. I can only say THANK YOU SONY!!

Reviews.Title: Great choice!!!
Reviews.Author: Laura Barry "LLB"
Reviews.Content: Great camera!  I've had it for a couple months - easy, fast, light, portable - NO issues!!!

Reviews.Title: Most bang for your buck.
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain
Reviews.Content: I'm just an novice photographer, so keep that in mind.  My thoughts of this camera is that I couldn't have found a better one for the money.  It takes excellent quality pics, and even the stupid pics I took when I accidentally had my finger on the button were in great quality and I was moving my hand pretty fast at the moment of capture.  If you're in the market for a great 200 buck camera, you won't go wrong if you get this one.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Audiophile
Reviews.Content: I've had so many cameras in my lifetime; so many that I couldn't even begin to count.  As a pocket P-n-S camera, my W290 is excellent; its pictures are crystal clear, features are abundant, 720p video feature is nice, and so forth.  This W290 compares very similarly to my previous Canon SD780, performance-wise.  The Canon is smaller, but the Sony has a bigger, nicer LCD screen.  All in all, very nice pocket camera to have when I'm not using my Sony and Nikon DSLRs.  I have so many cameras that I don't know what to do with them or why I just kept buying more and more.  :/

Reviews.Title: Sony Dropped the Ball
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: I had a Sony Cyber shot DSC-P10 for 7yrs before buying the DSC-W290 just before Halloween 2009.  I expected with the advancement of technology a camera 7yrs newer would blow my old camera out of the water.  This was not the case at all.  I had to pull out my old camera to go trick-or-treating to ensure I actually got some good pictures.  I actually took both cameras to compare later, and yes the 7yr old camera produced much better pictures.My number one complaint is that it is horrible at taking action shots.  I can barely get a picture of my kid sliding down the slide, running, or swinging; it's just one blur of colors.  The second complaint is the colors, especially red is all messed up.  I'm not a photographer, just a mom who wants to capture my kid's special and not so special moments.  I'm not sure what is wrong but reds tend to come out like fireballs where the red objects are almost glowing.  I have tried to fix the red but the other colors, which were fine, get dull and washed out.I guess if you could freeze time, adjust the camera to the new settings, then take the picture you might have a chance of overcoming the short falls of this camera.  However, in real life when the moment if gone it's gone.I can live with the red problem, but missing every picture at an outing with the kids is not an option.  I've had this camera and tried every setting for 3 months and I'm looking for a new camera even though for the price it should have met the needs of the basic user.Outdoor pictures tend to turn out better and landscape pictures are very nice as long as it's well before dusk.I do like the smile feature, it is much easier to use than a timer.  You can allow the camera to take a few pictures before the group moves and therefore increase your odds of getting people looking at the camera and smiling.The video feature is a great improvement over my old camera.  Actually in my opinion if it would only take the pictures with the same settings as it does the video it might actually be a good camera.

Reviews.Title: A slight step down from my old Cybershot
Reviews.Author: A. Sheffield
Reviews.Content: CONS:  No Manual Mode (you can't adjust shutter speed), Proprietary Battery, Proprietary Output CableMy old DSC (Cyberhot) had manual mode with all options adjustable, my old DSC used any AA battery of my choice, my old DSC used the standard mini USB connection and a standard A/V output jack.  These features alone kept me from rating this 5 stars.  Additionally, it doesn't use the regular "memory stick" my old DSC used.PROS:  Pretty much everything else.  Great price, very small and portable, easy to use, many options for taking pictures, surprisingly great video quality (though without zoom option) that I viewed on a 55" TV, picture quality is obviously not at the level of an SLR, but I am very happy with it.Overall I recommend the W290 as a simple, easy to use, inexpensive point and shoot camera.  I feel like it is a bit of a downgrade from my old DSC in terms of manual mode, battery type, output cable type, and memory stick type, but I still like it.

Reviews.Title: I love my camera!
Reviews.Author: Taylor Lynd
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with my camera.  The directions are easy to follow and the camera is lightweight and handles well. I'm looking forward to capturing many special memories.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera but not for cold or hot weather
Reviews.Author: B. Scholte
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 4 months now and have taken it on two overseas trips. I've probably taken 900 pictures with it. It's an easy to use small camera that takes great shots when the lighting is good.  In low lighting with motion, it can be blurry but I don't know how sensitive the sensors are compare to other cameras so it's tough to say it's better or worse than other cameras.  It takes great high definition video.Had one one problem on the last trip when the temperature was closer to 0-5C (32-40F).  In this case the lense cover didn't open or close all the way during multiple uses over 5 days.  It's as if there's a lubricant that get stiff in cold weather.  I'm back in warm weather now (60F) and only had the issue once since leaving the cold.The operators manual says that the operating temp is 0-40C (32-104F) which is a bit limiting if you are going to take it with you snow sking or in the desert.  Wish they would have had this spec on the Amazon site before I bought it.  I'm not sure how other digital cameras are temperature rated.

Reviews.Title: Sony digital camera
Reviews.Author: Shu Fang
Reviews.Content: This camera works great as a snap and shoot camera. The bigger lens helps capture larger area. Only draw back is the continuous shooting feature. It needs to be enable/disable in the setup menu. You cannot select it on the fly. Basically makes it almost unusable.

Reviews.Title: Amazing! Sony does it again...
Reviews.Author: Akshay K. Munshi
Reviews.Content: Another great product from Sony. I love the ease of use. It has really helped reduce the number of complaints from my wife. My kids are young - 6 and 4, so I dont let them try it, I am sure they would be able to use it equally well. The only issue for me, literally the only one, is that I have to hold the camera in its place for 1-2 secs more after I see the last flash to get the perfect pic. Again, I should expect that as it is not an SLR. Just something I had not expected from Sony, maybe I am expecting too much. The battery has not been designed to hold and use charge to fill 4GB disk with pics in one go. Thats how I rate the battery life.Pros: Picture quality, Ease of use, HD video, and other standard Sony featuresCons: Picture taking time, Battery life could have been better, Options in menu for certain settings.I also bought the soft case recommended with the product, but it fits too tight. I need a case that I can quickly put a camera in and take it out with one hand. The case seems to be designed for storage, defeats the purpose of hanging it on the belt. I had a bigger soft case from an earlier camera that I am using instead.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: picture taker
Reviews.Content: Received the camera very quickly and in perfect condition.A good camera for the price. When the battery is low, but still able to take pictures, the screen gets stripes across it. The marks don't come out on the pictures, but it's disconcerting. Also, you have to be very careful when you press the buttons. The camera is very sensitive, and it is easy to erase more pictures than you intend to.The camera takes good pictures in different kinds of light, is easy to operate, and easy to understand. It also looks very nice. My son liked it, but this one is mine! I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: A. Dhingra "Amit"
Reviews.Content: The camera is good option for quick focus and shoot amd  without too many  complex operations. Nice grip compared to similar camera's. Overall nice results though night shots still a challenge .. may be I need to get the settings the correct setting

Reviews.Title: The Best Camera i've ever had!
Reviews.Author: NasaGirl "Astrid"
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with this camera (Sony Cyber-shot w290 blue) since the first time i saw it. I just had to get it! Seriously, it's the best i've ever had. The picture quality is Great! *picture perfect*. It also captures HD video. The only thing about this camera is that it's a bit "Fat" and with some weight to it, but i got used to it after awhile. Another little detail is the battery life, i wish it would last more but that depends on how much you use it of course, so i would recommend to buy a spare battery to have charged and ready to go. Other than that, this little baby is great! i love the big screen it has. The menu is very easy to control. It's an attractive camera and for the price it's totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Bruce Chrisp
Reviews.Content: I love the camera, great photo quality. I love all of the features too, especially the ability to shoot 720p video with sound. I wish the camera came with an AC/DC adaptor, this has to be purchased separately.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290
Reviews.Author: Andres Ruiz Acevedo "Andres"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a really nice acquisition. Pictures are easy to take, the colors are awesome, and even if you are in motion like inside a car, the pictures I've been able to take with it amaze me. You have to ensure that whenever you take pictures at night and you want them perfect, the camera has to be as still as possible since any trembling hand will ruin the picture. I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Arpit Shah
Reviews.Content: i did purchase this camera before 2 weeksAnd picture quality is very sharp and cleari tried to capture some photos in night..but in night can't get clear picture..but this is not erroralso i took one HD video....really video clarity is also awesome

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: R. Shyyka "Roxy10"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and i love it. Great camera, can be a little bit cheaper, but when you buy sony, you always pay a little more for brand. Anyway it worth it!!!! Fast shipping!!!

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290
Reviews.Author: M. S. Yates "Chico57"
Reviews.Content: A great little camera. I have had excellant service from the Sony products that I have purchased during my lifetime. Never have I been disapponted. The track record remains in tact with this double purchase. We purchased two of these cameras as Christmas gifts for our two daughters this year. They were tickled to death. The cameras arrived in a very timely manner and were both in excellant condition. Our girls are very very pleased with the quality of the pictures the cameras take and with the excellant quality of the lithium battery. Thanks for selling these at such a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the right user
Reviews.Author: Amazonian
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera with many cool features. It's a good buy on Amazon, much cheaper than retail when I bought it.  I have always loved Sony products.  The reason why I rated it the way I did because I am not a tech savvy person, this camera was bit too complicated for me to use.  I like a camera with basic functions and take clear pictures that's it.  Maybe I'll have to put aside some time to get to know my camera more.

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: Brian P "Brian P"
Reviews.Content: takes good pictures in easy mode, gets blurry unless set perfectly in any other mode. wife tends to hit the mode button constantly with her thumb, so we get alot of poor pictures. really have to watch hand placement.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Heather L. Morgan
Reviews.Content: I love the camera.  It is easy to use and verry portible. The picture quality is amaysing and video is great at 720p resolution.  I used to have a fujifilm s700 and this is way better and smaller.  If you are considering another camera with simaller specs get this one!  I love phography and was origanally going to get an slr but this is way better in most ways.  Im a guy and at first when I was about to order it I thought that the blue looks girlish.  But when I opend the box I saw that it looked great for men and women.

Reviews.Title: no complaints
Reviews.Author: S. Metzger "Dundun"
Reviews.Content: best priced and featured camera with HD video. What sold me was the speed of the camera. Very fast 2.3 fps. flipping through photos is quick. erasing is quick. it takes less than a second to turn it on completely. the screen i found to be much clearer than Nikon's OLED S70.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Trevor Livingston "TL"
Reviews.Content: You Will Love This Camera!  The Best HD Camera For The Price![...]

Reviews.Title: Travel camera
Reviews.Author: Marlene E. Bryant "Garden bird"
Reviews.Content: Good size for travel, and routine fun shooting.  OK for an amateur photographer, but that's it.  Has some good features, but not much zoom so be prepared.  I do like the size, and weight, and of course the color.  I have the blue.  Have not used it for scenery, so can't comment.  All in all, I like it enough to have given one to a good friend for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera - Very good investment
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Rivip"
Reviews.Content: Even my wife likes it!!Very easy to use. Features are easy to understand and controls are of easy access.What I like the most about it, besides its picture quality, it's the ability to play the photos and videos right on your TV using the audio/video cable included in the package. Videos are HD so if you have an HDTV...you will love it!Automatic scene selection does what is *supposed* to.Ah...the application that comes on the CD (PMB) I highly recommend it (install it).The only drawbacks are: Battery life, and the screen catches a lot of finger prints.In summary, it's a wonderful camera for the amateur photographer who cares about picture quality and portability, at a very reasonable price.Search no more...you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this camera, smile shutter works great!
Reviews.Author: John D. Townsend "johnnytucf"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife for Christmas and it's worked out great so far.  The camera is smaller than my wife's old camera, but the 3" display screen is actually bigger so it works out great and has good quality imaging.The coolest thing we like so far though, is the smile shutter.  We just had a baby and sometimes it's hard to catch his smile, however with the smile shutter it automatically takes a picture when he smiles.  The sensitivity feature for it works great, and it's so easy to turn off and on, it's its own button on the top of the camera.The only knock we have so far is the video quality is a little grainy, but we have a separate video camera.  We only use this camera for video when the other one isn't available.-Had to Edit to four stars...the auto lens cover stopped working after about 4 months.

Reviews.Title: Good one for the value
Reviews.Author: R. Tiwari
Reviews.Content: This is a good product with easy use and intelligent features which makes it use at any location and anytime. The steady image feature is excellent and gives really crispy images.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Kosiorek
Reviews.Content: This camera recieved a top review by Consumer Reports.  I am also extremely impressed.  Great features and an excellend intelligent more if you just like to point and shoot.  Excellent night pictures.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Honeymoon camera!
Reviews.Author: Vanessa Campos
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I took this camera to Jamaica and had a blast with it!It was so easy to use and the twilight feature with no flash is amazing for those night photos!I highly recommend spending the extra money for this model. We couldn't have wonderful picturesfrom our honeymoon to share with all of our friends and family without this camera! The video wasamazing and the playback of videos have easy viewing with the big screen. We also lovedhow small and portable so having it in a bag on the beach was no problem! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: It fullfils what it promisses
Reviews.Author: M. Ungar
Reviews.Content: Got the camera and started to use it right immediately.All what it promissed is truth.Excellent pictures and easy to use.I recomend the camera as it is the best you can get for the dollars you spend

Reviews.Title: Finally, a point and shoot that captures exactly what you see.
Reviews.Author: Davis
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this camera is AWESOME! It captures colors brilliantly and the image stabilizer makes images crystal clear.Also, this camera has an amazing video camera feature which shoots in High Definition. The audio on the video is also of high quality. I use this camera more for taking videos than I do my video camera.Anyone taking ALL bad shots with this camera has no clue what they're doing.

Reviews.Title: great gift
Reviews.Author: Samantha Walker
Reviews.Content: I got this as a christmas present from my dad. I go through cameras pretty quickly and this one is a replacement of my Sony Cybershot 10 mega pixel. It's really great, I absolutely love it. The video quality is amazing, if quite short even with the extra memory stick. Its a little difficult to figure out at first which shooting mode you need to be in, but I'm sure that's just because I'm not the type of person who reads directions. Eventually I've figured it out, and like I said it's great quality.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber Shot
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I like the larger veiw finder.  It seems like our picts are clearer than what we had before.  I am one that needs a unit that is easy to use. It has many features and quality of shots are good.  We had one like this before and the veiw screen broke when someone put it in their back pocket, so beware it did not get hit just twisted when that person sat down.

Reviews.Title: Camera is good But I expected still more on one feature
Reviews.Author: Suguna K. Koduri
Reviews.Content: I brought this camera during thanks giving holiday deals. The deal is good and it reached me with the expected date.I selected this camera because it has a new feature called SMILEY with which it will take pictures automatically when it is on and someone smiling. But this feature not that much working as I expected. Even though I set for very small smile also, It is taking some time to recognize smile and not taking the pictures.I tried for my daughter, by the time it takes the picture, my daughter stops smiling and I am not getting the smily picture.Except this, The camera is good and working very fine.Regards,Kumar.

Reviews.Title: Low picture quality
Reviews.Author: Mihail Spasov
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera because of a relatively positive review on CNET. Fairly disappointed with it because of grainy images. Another problem was that the lenses didn't want to come out. I fixed it by taking it out manually (meaning with my fingers). Since then haven't had the problem. Come to think of it, maybe it would have been better not to fix it  which would have given me an excuse to return it. The positive thing about the camera is that if you don't mind the grainy images then it's a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera !!!
Reviews.Author: L. Gladkowski
Reviews.Content: I am so happy with this purchase. It responds quickly to photo taking. No waiting for the picture to adjust. I love the smile feature,automatically takes photo once everyone is smiling. I battery life has been good so far. I have only had the camera a few weeks but I have only charged the battery one time. It has been in stand by for most of the time. My last camera died 30 minutes after removing it from the charger. Over all I am thrilled!

Reviews.Title: Love my Sony
Reviews.Author: Steve D. Wymer "cougar steve"
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best I have owned. I love the features, it's a great size and for less than $200 there is no better value.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use & intelligent camera
Reviews.Author: Vijay S. Rajanna
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera thinking of giving it as a gift to my mom. I used to to see how it is, and now I have decided to keep it myself and buy another for my mom. I have used Canon S3IS for 2.5 years now. This Sony camera is better than my old Canon. Go for it.

Reviews.Title: Worth the Money
Reviews.Author: Compulsive Shopper
Reviews.Content: Every where I go I carry a camera.  You never know when you'll need to video or photograph something or someone.  When I purchased this camera I was very excited to see how it held up.  There really are only two settings you'll use - video and basic photograph.  But I have to say, I've never seen a camera take such sharp photographs as this camera.  You literally just point and shoot and the contrast is amazing.  The video footage is very clear but you'll need to make certain that it's completely in focus prior to hitting the record button. If not, the camera will take about a minute to refocus so the first part will be somewhat blurry.  Once in focus the camera may as well be a full-fledged video camera.  The sharpness is as distinctive as the protographs it produces.  I love this camera and everyone who has seen the photographs have gone out to buy one for themselves.  It's literally dummy-proof.

Reviews.Title: W290 beats W220 - own both, uses same accessories
Reviews.Author: R. White "GreatDanes4U"
Reviews.Content: Got a Sony Cybershot W220 camera and wife loved it. Also got extended warranty from Vann's SquareDeal. After reading manual I had to have the deluxe Cybershot so I bought the W290 for me with more advanced features and easier to use menu plus better zoom than W220. I liked the W290 so much more than the W220 I told my wife I would sell it for a loss or I was going to give the W220 to a family member and buy another W290! She said she liked it so we keep both :-)  I liked the W220 until I got the W290 with easier menu and more features such as underwater, (we hope to go back to the Philippines and "Swim with the Fishes") and other open shutter ability on a tripod to take low light photos similliar to SLR capabilities.  The LCD is bigger but what is also handy is all the accessories work on both.  However for the deep water case to work on various Cybershots different inserts have to be changed.  Other than that, and I doubt most folks need the 134 foot water proof case - it is GREAT for the $$$!!!

Reviews.Title: I love the color!!!
Reviews.Author: Norman F. Kosty
Reviews.Content: I am totally satisfied with the camera. I love the video quality and if you set it up right, the pictures are phanominal. This camera is definitely a value at the price. The color is a very sharp, ice blue, I love it.

Reviews.Title: Just an average novice camera owner review
Reviews.Author: Dave Aswat
Reviews.Content: Hioverall i would have to say this is a good camera and a worthwhile investment for your average everyday snapshot photographer.It is worthwhile to read the manual and get accostomed to the controls although you can basically power up and take shots without worrying to much.the interface is fairly easy to navigate although i did have a problem one night turning on the flash in a dark area because i couldn't see the screen so sony might want to take that into consideration.the HD video was quite nice, better than i expected, go to youtube and search for bball finals night in barbados to get an example. it functioned well in a low light setting although i was disappointed that there was no zooming in video mode, something to fix in my opinion.regular snapshops were fine and i think the detail on the highest resolution we exception.well done sonyminor issues to sort out onlythanks alot!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Bernie41 "Bernie41"
Reviews.Content: This is my second Cyber-shot. The last one was damaged beyond repair on a fishing trip. The new one is even better, particularly in being more "user friendly" and offering more customization for special photos. The other nice and unexpected thing I learned is that even though my old camera was about 3 years old, I can use the same battery and charger. Now, I have a back-up battery that I salvaged from the damaged unit. The other nice feature is the little sounds that confirm various selections when making adjustments to the many options within the menu. I had the new unit about one month and probably taken 100 pics and am totally satisfied.

Reviews.Title: this camera is great
Reviews.Author: P. Schafer
Reviews.Content: so I had two previous Sony cameras... I've always had really good experiences with the brand.  yeah, some will say you can get a better bang for your buck, but really you won't go wrong with this camera.  it takes great pictures, the settings are really easy to use, and the video is great quality.  i'm really happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: For the price, outstanding
Reviews.Author: Mark Kolesar
Reviews.Content: This is my second digital camera.  The first was a Canon Rebel SLR.  Since it is a SLR, it can take some amazing shots, but the much cheaper Sony W290 produces better shots in low light.  Certainly, the Sony has great portability - put it in your pocket, vs. the SLR bulk.  Anyway, for the price point, this camera has very good, fast shutter response (low shutter lag) which is great for pictures of the dog.  The picture mode options are very easy to understand and the automatic mode does a great job.  Understandability vs. the expensive Canon is tremendous.One problem: I edited several pictures (crop, zoom, etc.) on the camera and saved them.  I viewed them several times, then suddenly, they would not diplay on the camera and a file error code came up.  This turned out to be ok since the edited pictures could still be downloaded to a computer and they were fine, as edited/saved.  Sony's help/ support site offered no help except to suggest not editing on the camera - THAT'S A COP OUT SONY!!!  I would expect more from them.  Also, the cable with multiple connections is clunky.  Why not use a more standardized connection like the several cables I have that connect my phones or MP3 players to the computer?Overall, I am very satisfied with the performance of this camera for a couple hundred bucks.

Reviews.Title: DSC-W290
Reviews.Author: Chris "Chris"
Reviews.Content: I am not fully satisfied with the picture quality. But considering its low price, it's acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: Shridhar Taranath "photomat"
Reviews.Content: I have yet to completely familiaeize with this camera.  But I really like it.

Reviews.Title: A great gift!
Reviews.Author: S. S. Mulvaney "Vinha"
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera and I sent it to my daughter as a gift. My intention was to give her something that I could have back: too many great cool pictures of my 6 months grandbaby-girl! And it worked!!! She just loved the gift and told me how amazing is to use the camera and to get shots of the baby's smile! Now I can see all the "faces" baby is making for grandmma!I do recomend this product especially if you live faraway from your family!

Reviews.Title: Typical Sony Product
Reviews.Author: California Dad
Reviews.Content: This camera is worth the price!  Of course Canon is probably the best point and shoot camera out on the market in terms of picture clarity. However, to get the same features on a Canon, I would have to pay $100 more.  I am not a pro photographer.  If I was I would have bought an SLR instead.  I wanted a camera that is simple to use for me and especially my wife.  Most pictures are clear.  You will have difficulty in low light situations, however.  I am satisfied with the action shots for a point and shoot.  The HD video is adequate.  I would rather sacrifice a little image clarity than have to carry around both a camera and a video cam.  Of course I love that it fits in my pocket so I don't have to carry a camera case.  The camera start up is fast, but there is a lag time between pictures if you are using the flash.  The burst option is great to take action shots.  I don't use the smile recognition much.  The person's smile must be large to be recognized.  The 3 inch screen is fantastic and the buttons and control dial are simple and easy to use.  I can see someone with large hands having a problem with the dial.  I just wish I could zoom in and out while shooting video.  A perfect point and shoot would have this option and have more zoom capability.

Reviews.Title: Best in class.  Great pictures and HD videos. But still has some flaws.
Reviews.Author: Identifying Flaws - even in the things I love
Reviews.Content: All in all a great camera that takes great photos and videos.  I think it's one of the very best point-and-shoots.  Consumer Reports thought its predecessor the Cybershot w300 was the best in its class.  The w290 costs at least $100 less than its discontinued predecessor and only gives up some unnecessary features and about 1.5 megapixels.  I actually appreciate the reduction because, at 12.1 the pictures are still great but the files are about 10% smaller.The software's ability to identify faces and adjust to scenes is very good.  (The smile detection feature is extremely cool for showing friends but not terribly useful.)  The very large screen looks terrific when playing back photos and videos.  While it's reason for being is to take great photos, I must say I'm a huge fan of having an HD video recorder in my pocket.I love the w290 but it isn't perfect: It is not as small/sleek as a Canon Elph but I think the pictures and especially videos are much better - and that's why I love the Cybershot.  The fact that the Sony is about $100 less expensive than a comparable Canon Elph was an added bonus.Downsides:  In low light pictures are sometimes fuzzy or noisy.  This is generally most noticeable if you review the photo and zoom in close.  Without zooming in its less noticeable.Having to use Sony's proprietary accessories is annoying(eg camera does not take a standard mini USB; you also have to use a memory stick instead of the typical SD card) and was almost a deal breaker, but the quality of the camera and pix/videos won me over.  I used the money I saved to buy my memory stick and still had plenty left over.Like all other cameras I found with HD video, this one doesn't let you zoom while recording and the files are massive - making them tough to email to friends and family.Despite these flaws, I still think this is the best point and shoot in its class and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Best Camara I have ever bought!
Reviews.Author: Carla R. Grossman
Reviews.Content: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290 12 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and Super Steady Shot Image Stabilization (Silver)I love to take pictures but didn't want the hassle of having to set the settings before taking the pictures. This pretty much is a "point and shoot" camara. My pictues have turned out beautiful! Best investment I have made in a camara choice.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth D. Janz
Reviews.Content: I had some trouble getting used to this camera but now it takes lovely pictures when I have it at the right setting.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: O.O. "oxo"
Reviews.Content: I think Sony accomplishes a great job with this camera. The picture quality is extremely high even when you move the camera while taking the photo. Night pictures are great without flash once you stable the camera. Great performance indeed!

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: M. Guzman
Reviews.Content: I only have 2 days with the cam, and i love it, take amazing pics no matter what, the quality of the video is really great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Cory S. Krueger
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an easy to use high quality digital camera.  I am very pleased with the quality of the images.  The Menues are very easy to use, and the software that comes with the camera is very useful as well.  I have no specific complaints with the product and would recommend it to anyone wanting an excellent product.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Negi D
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife as she wanted a small camera for her.  Needless to say I love it as well.  Pictures are sharp even in low lights and indoors.  With my Canon she had trouble having a very steady hand for a good pic.  With Sony Cybershot DSC W290 even my 5 year old took some awesome pictures.  I am extremely happy with this purchase and just ordered an extra Memory card as the one I have is only 1GB.  I would have given it 5 stars if it could use SD card and standard USB cable.

Reviews.Title: best camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: C. S. Norton
Reviews.Content: We've had many cameras over the years but this is amazing.  The Zeiss lens takes the sharpest photos. The instant you push the power button it is on and ready.  The size and weight make it easy to carry in my purse so I take more photos.  We love the wide angle lens.  It is so smart it knows to chage to macro automatically or to take to exposures and let us decide what look we wanted.  we just love it.

Reviews.Title: Sony Digital Cameras
Reviews.Author: Walter Vargas Navarro "Walter Vargas"
Reviews.Content: The products are excellent, nice color, size and technical characteristics. I am very satisfied.Thanks

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Danielle Clayton
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera so that we had a new nicer camera for when our son was born! We love it, it takes great pictures, takes  them fast, and havent had any problems, battery life is great, however we bought another battery because we didnt want to be screwed if one was dead because we forgot to charge....highly recommend but get another battery...always nice to have a back up.

Reviews.Title: I want more
Reviews.Author: Andrew J. Washington "Boys In Blue"
Reviews.Content: I resently got a chance to start using the camera.  So far, so good.  I getting use to several features on this model.  I would like to have the manuel controls that comes on the 300 model, especially the shutter speed selection.  The size and weight of the camera are just right.  A view finder would do some good.  Overall I would recomend this camera.

Reviews.Title: It is a very nice camara
Reviews.Author: Oscar Ynsfran Mallorquin
Reviews.Content: I like very much this camera!It would be nicer if it had a manual setting.

Reviews.Title: Going back to the store, goodbye restock fee
Reviews.Author: C. High
Reviews.Content: We needed to replace our trusty Canon SD700 with something less beaten by age. With a baby blog, indoor picture quality and fast flash reload were a must.Now this is not just a Sony thing - one of the newer Canons we tried (the 880IS) along with, I'm sure, the dozens of other marketing-driven high megapixel count cameras suffer from the same problem - was lots of noise all over the pictures. But ESPECIALLY indoors. At all the best quality setting, this brand new camera couldn't hold a candle to the ragged 4-year old Elph. Colors were washed out, grainy textures appeared on smooth hardwood floors.Of course, we have to buy the $40 Memory Stick and an adapter because Sony's still beating that dead horse while everyone else has long agreed to more prevalent SD cards. We have two different laptops, they both have SD slots too - which used to make it easy to post images from the comfort of our living room - but with this we have to go downstairs to the office PC to use the big multi-card reader.But you ask, why not just keep the little USB-to-Camera cable handy? Surely it came with one right? No!! In yet another ridiculous proprietary scheme, the only cable (and slot for the cable on the camera) is a juggernaut, 3-in-1 video, audio, and USB cable for hooking up to the TV (RGB only) or USB port. You have a micro USB cable lying around? TOO BAD! You can't USE it.On the upside, the outdoor shots were nearly indistinguishable from the quality we're used to - bright and clear with less noise than indoors. The video would "speckle" on occasion but basically looked good.Our Canon SX200 is arriving tomorrow, we're super excited. Shame we'll be losing $40 returning an item we have no way of testing prior to purchase, thanks Best Buy.

Reviews.Title: Not good product from Sony!
Reviews.Author: Patrick Nguyen "Trance Music"
Reviews.Content: Ok, I have tried out couple Canon PowerShot SD790IS 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and Canon PowerShot SD1200IS 10 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom, which I gave these 2 cameras 3 stars, then I went on and tried Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W230 12 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom and Super Steady Shot Image Stabilization, and I love this camera, pictures from this camera are very vivid and beautiful.  I would give this camera 4 stars.  So I decide to get Cyber-shot DSC-W290 12.1 MP Digital Camera, because it's more expensive, and I called Dell.com, they told me, it's made in Japan, which I think Japan made product is better, so I got this camera from Dell, when it came, open the box, it made in China:(Now, I can compare 2 Sony cameras W230 and W290.1- W230 pictures' colors is much much better than W290, dont know why!2- W230 starts up much faster than W290.3- W230 take better pictures not as blur like W290, and I don't know why.4- W230 is cheaper than W290 about 40 dollarsW230 seem to be a much faster camera than W290 and cheaper.  Another thing about purchasing camera, I think you should go to the store and check out the cameras yourself, check, feel, compare all the cameras that you like and pick out the best one that you like, remember each person has different taste of thing:)So I returned W290 to Dell and kept W230.

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality ruins an otherwise good camera
Reviews.Author: Jason Smid
Reviews.Content: I used to own a Sony DSC-p10, it's a 5 megapixel camera from around 2003. The camera was great, but finally gave up, mostly due to abuse. Since I had such good luck with my first Sony camera, I decided it would be great to get another Sony over the more popular Cannon's. I got this camera around the end of June, which at the time of my writing this was 4 months ago and I've taken just over 600 pictures.Let's start out with the good:The display is huge, and easy to see things in. Everyone that uses this camera comments on how big and nice the display is.Battery life is outstanding. Actually, what's better than outstanding? I'm not sure, but that's what it is. Kudos to Sony on this one, I've charged the battery 3-4 times since I've owned the camera.The video is phenomenal, quality is better than I would expect out of a point-and-shoot but it suffers from the same focus problem as the still shots, which I'll explain later.Feature wise, this camera has plenty... mostly you'll probably never use.One of the reasons I got this camera is because I was familiar with the Sony menu system, so as far as I'm concerned it's easy to use but this is more opinion than fact.The camera is fast, or at least I've not noticed it being slow which is a welcome change from my previous camera.The zoom works as expected, nothing good or bad to report. It doesn't work while recording a video but that's not really a big deal to me.Size is good for me, but I'm a guy and have big pockets. It's slightly larger than some other point and shoot's but it's also mostly screen. Can't have everything.Now for the knit-picky things,There's no viewfinder, and the screen doesn't work very well in direct sunlight. It's bright enough to be seen outdoors if you're facing the right direction, but I've found myself wanting a viewfinder a few times. Its lack of one is no surprise though, since I clearly knew this before I bought the camera.Whenever I hand this camera to someone to take a picture of me, they are ALWAYS confused by the buttons. There's the goofy "smile detection" button on the top, as well as on/off and shutter. The shutter button is oblong and apparently confuses people. I feel it's a bit hard to push with my big paw sized hands. It would be nicer if it was a round button that protruded from the top of the cam.The mode selection wheel often turns its self in my pocket or backpack and I find myself taking videos instead of pictures too often.The lanyard that came with the camera didn't have the little clip that slides on it to snug it up to your wrist, which pretty much defeats the point of a lanyard in the first place. This seems like a very silly place to save $.01. I used the lanyard from my previous camera, and it works great.This camera uses a proprietary plug to attach to the computer and requires an external battery charger. This is basically the same thing that Cannon does, but my old Sony camera used a standard mini-usb style plug and I could plug the charger directly into the cam without removing the battery.If you've made it this far, you're probably still seriously interested in buying this camera, and I don't blame you. Most of the things I listed above aren't really that big of a deal. But honestly, don't buy this camera, and here's why:The image quality is AWFUL. TERRIBLE. WRETCHED. This thing's supposed to be a 12 megapixel awesome fantastic camera, but my old 5 megapixel camera from 2003 took better pictures hands down. The W290's daylight performance is acceptable... not fantastic, but I could live with it. The low-light performance if this camera is really bad though. Pictures that are even in moderate light start to become grainy way before they should and the flash doesn't make up for it.That's not the worst part though; the autofocus of this camera is worthless. I've taken more out of focus pictures in the past 4 months than the past 4 years. It's always confused, zooming the focus in and out trying to pick out whatever is in the foreground. I've tried center focus, multifocus, etc and nothing seems to help. Medium light action shots are impossible. Most recently, I tried to take a picture of my girlfriend moving her head while in the bleachers at a stadium at night with all the stadium lights on... the flash went off (it was on "easy mode") and still she motion blurred AND out of focus, this is just unacceptable. In another case I tried to take photos of dolphins off of the bow of a fishing boat at high noon (plenty of light) and the camera was unable to properly focus. I took photos in exactly the same conditions with my previous camera and they turned out perfect.Basically, in closing, this camera is worthless unless you just want some flashy looking toy that you can maybe take non-action pictures outside on sunny days with. Good luck shopping elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Not at all impressed
Reviews.Author: Islas Virgenes
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera in an attempt to locate an upgrade to our old Kodak EasyShare DX7590 5mpx.  What a disappointment.  This camera, though 12.1mpx, does not deliver quality photos nor does it stabilize images.  You 'think' the photos are crisp when viewed on the live viewer, however once uploaded, you see a slightly different reality.  The photos are blurry, have shadows, rain and glares galore.  The video isn't as good either.  When uploaded and viewed on your TV or computer, the frames per second looks choppy.  Unfortunately we are back to the drawing board now looking into purchasing a Canon, with $300 down the drain.  I still can't understand how it has gotten so much positive reviews.  Perhaps I received a defective model, or all these reviewers have either never had a digital camera in their life or have yet to upload the photos they've taken to their computer.  Please don't waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: SAVE YOUR $$.  HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT.
Reviews.Author: A. Nelson
Reviews.Content: I have never been so disappointed in ANY purchase I've EVER made.  This camera is cute.  Period.  I have yet to take a picture with it, regardless of the setting, that is clear enough for any kind of use.  This INCLUDES using a tripod.  Pictures are blurry, grainy, UGLY.  What a waste of money.  I'm throwing it in the TRASH after two months of having it and going back to a Canon!!  Talk about feeling ripped off... thanks, Sony.  :(

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: J. Gibson
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife but I wanted something I could use to do more challenging type shots and videos.  I was impressed it would allow for HD Video recording (720P).  We took the camera on our vacation to Vegas and the Grand Canyon.  It did a great job.  The quality of recording and picture was outstanding.  I was a little disappointed that I could not zoom while recording video (could zoom in while paused and re-start recording) and also the auto focus seemed to "hunt" a lot when doing movie recordings.  I would have liked more options for focus in the movie mode other than Auto and Fixed Infinity.  Other than that it was a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Thanks item received
Reviews.Author: Jose Velasquez
Reviews.Content: tem arrived in optimal conditions and the expected timepicked this item for the brand and priceI liked the model

Reviews.Title: Excellent user friendly camera
Reviews.Author: DJTOONZ
Reviews.Content: I find the Sony's way more user friendly than the Cannon camera's.  I'm a techie and Cannon's confuse even me!  Sony just makes a great product!  This one is one of my favorites so far.  I love the feature where it will take a picture as soon as someone in the viewfinder smiles!  So cool!  How the heck does it know!?!  Anyway, great camera!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Mata Hari "neopoetess"
Reviews.Content: Better than the Cyber-shot I lost.. Easy to use, takes pics with a little movement and they come out crisp. Movies are lovely.  Very happy with my purchase.  I love SONY

Reviews.Title: bad choice
Reviews.Author: Riki Pery Zohar
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, a bad decision to buy this camera, photo camera images of the level of 3 megapixels, the video quality is good

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290 - Good picture quality - No Good Moving object pics
Reviews.Author: Saravanan "Sancan"
Reviews.Content: Has very good pic quality and extremely easy to use.It is not capturing moving objects pics.  I tried the Int' mode and Easy mode.Other feature are very good.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-W290 EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: Ivaylo Krumov
Reviews.Content: We bought this PaS (Point and Shoot) camera for our vacation. My previous camera is Sony DSC-W7 and I was expecting to have at least the same quality of the new one. Surprisingly the new DSC-W-290 was outstanding all my expectations. The camera is nice, light and very very portable. The pictures are really amazing! You feel that every one is better than the previous one. The menu offers many features which are more than enough for the category this camera belongs to. I was on a crossroad between this one and Canon but after several tests and comparisons I believe SONY caught my sympathy. The camera has quick reaction responding well to your changes of the options. The display is nice and bright. The battery's life is really long. One battery charge-discharge cycle has approximately 280 pictures with FLASH !!!! If you need even longer battery life, you could purchase a battery which has 1200mA hours or even bigger. This camera is really good for people who are not professional but want to have excellent pictures every time they use it. The only one minor concern I have is the power-on button and the point-shoot button. They are little smaller than I would like which makes them little hard to feel them under your fingers when you use the camera. I consider this as a minor negative point because after a little while you become comfortable with them. It just need some practice.Overall this is 5 stars ***** camera

Reviews.Title: its okay but expected more from sony
Reviews.Author: aparate
Reviews.Content: i have been an ardent fan of picture quality of sony cameras and that was the reason i bought this camera. this piece is compact (fits nicely in jeans pocket), looks great, feels comfortable in hands (the large screen makes it up for very small menu, display and delete buttons), has intelligent auto mode but the picture quality is not what i expected ... i have had this camera for about a week now and all the photos i took were taken outside in full daylight ... in no way do i mean that the photos were bad but they were not very good ... so i am a bit disappointed

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Matias Zanartu
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Finding the right case was tough, though. After trying several ones in Sears, I bought a nice one that fits perfectly and has room for a battery: Caselogic Pocket Video Camcorder Case (TBC-312). This case model comes in two sizes though. The camera fits in both but I liked better the smaller one. If you are looking for a case, I recommend you to visit a camera/electronic store and try some cases by yourself. It's the only way you can be completely sure about this. I spent too much time looking for the right case online and could not find it.

Reviews.Title: Great video, okay pictures
Reviews.Author: P. Thornley
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the 720p video. The video quality is really quite good. The picture quality was not as great as I expected. I believe my 3yr old Canon A610 has a better picture quality.I have returned the camera and purchased the Canon SD7800. Much better pictures, and just as good video.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: C. McOmish
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, has some fun features, like the smile recognition, and the interface is reasonably easy to use after a bit of a play getting used to where everything is. It turns on quite quickly and takes nice photos, the only small complaint I have is that it is a little bigger than I would ideally like from a compact camera

Reviews.Title: I thought this camera was too good to be true...
Reviews.Author: Mutter am Liebsten "d."
Reviews.Content: --and it turns out I was right.This is one of the worst cameras I have ever used. Yeah sure--12.1 megapixels sounds great, right?  well, they are as long as you can get a clear shot using this camera.  90% of my shots are either fuzzy or blurry no matter what I do.  I have to stand perfectly still and have my subject hold their breath to get a decent shot. Not one is crystal clear out of 200 shots.  This is a pathetic piece of unprogressive technology.  Oh---AND good luck trying to take 20 shots without using up one bar of the battery. IT RUNS OUT QUICK!  I would use it for 15 minutes and then have to take a break to find an outlet to charge it up so I wouldn't miss a great shot.  But you know what?  When those great shots come along--this camera would catch it in all of it's BLURRY glory.  The buttons are annoyingly tiny and uncomfortable to use.  this thing is horrible.  So Sad!

Reviews.Title: Do not purchase! Only used 6 times before it broke. Sony will NOT replace or repair!!
Reviews.Author: Sara Hemmer "that's me!"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Sony CyberShot camera and was satisfied with the performance. I purchased it in May 09 and used it only 5 or 6 times. (I have another non-auto 35mm I use for most occasions). It is stored in a padded case inside a dresser drawer in my bedroom. I live alone, no one else had access. Next time I went to use it, it had no charge. Used the wall charger to no avail. Hooked up to my computer. Again, no lights, no response, Nothing! So After calling Sony's customer service (received only an outgoing message referring to website!!, no ability to leave message or get a person. Spent an hour searching for warranty info on Sony's website. Followed instructions carefully and send in for service.Received an email giving me 1 day to call them and respond to their repair estimate. Again, followed their instructions (inconvenient, at best)and was notified the warranty did NOT COVER the problem w/ the camera. That an internal part was corroded. But, I bought the camera NEW from Amazon and NEVER got it near water. The unhelpful technician told me my only recourse was to contact Sony and he gave me a 'direct number' for customer services. This number was the same as the one referenced above.Only an outgoing message!!DO NOT BUY SONY CAMERAS UNLESS YOU ARE WILLING TO PAY $300 FOR A DISPOSABLE CAMERA WITH ONLY 5 USES!!!

Reviews.Title: Burned Pixel
Reviews.Author: Americo Dos S. Brites Jr.
Reviews.Content: Camera was delivered with problem. All high definition pictures and videos shows a white dot.Looks like a burned dot on the CCD cell.

Reviews.Title: Super Steady Shot Image Stabilization? REALLY? LIARS!
Reviews.Author: S. singh Dhamrhat "Desi"
Reviews.Content: this has to be, by far, the worst digital camera i've ever used!!! i have had 2 sony's prior to this camera and have had no problems with them. this camera, however, is horrible!I had this camera for 1 day and these are the problems i came across:1) absolutely horrendous blurring in shots. i dont have shaky hands at all and out of approximately 20 shots i took, only 1 was in focus. i took some shots using a tripod and they came out fine but i've never had a problem w/blurry pictures when taking the shots by hand... lighting conditions were really good and still the shots were blurry!!!2) terrible video!!! while taking video and moving the camera around in good light conditions, the focus goes in and out! i never had this problem with my other 2 sony cameras... you cannot watch a video you take with this camera - your eyes will go bad from the focusing issues.stay away from this camera!!! i am a sony fan but this camera really makes me think twice about their products.... so im returning it to amazon tomorrow and wondering what to replace it with.... in general, cameras have bad picture quality in low light conditions but this camera has bad picture quality in good light conditions! this camera is unusable and worthless, IMO. at $30, i still wouldnt buy this hunk of junk.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-W290
Reviews.Author: Steen Hansen "seh2000"
Reviews.Content: My first Sony Cyber-shot "standalone" camera as I had Sony Ericsson mobiles with build-in Cyber-shot cameras, as I was happy with the performance from the Mobile Cyber-shots I purchased the DSC=W290 as my "old" canon 800IS was ready to be changed.Basically I am NOT happy with the performance, slow in been ready from shot to shot, face detection does not work all the time, skin tones tend to be yellowish, auto focus is not 100% correct.I will not recommend the DSC-W290 to others and I am to go back to Canon as my "old" 800IS performce better than this Sony.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Kalibr
Reviews.Content: I ordered the new Sony W290 for a cruise we're taking in a couple weeks. Having owned a few Sony cameras, I'm very familiar with Sony's quality and performance. I am actually a huge fan of Sony products, so I was looking forward to receiving my new camera.I had also considered the Canon SD970IS. I have owned several Canon PowerShot models throughout the years. However, the Canon was priced $140 more than the Sony, which led me to decide on the W290. After all, their features were comparable (12.1 Megapixel, 5X optical zoom, HD video, etc.).When I received the camera, I charged the battery and began taking test still shots and video. I made several indoor and outdoor shots to test the cameras capabilities. As soon as I downloaded the files to my PC, I immediately noticed that the pictures were grainy and not very sharp. Although they were taken at the camera's highest resolution (4000 x 3000), they looked like they were taken in low res or even from a cell phone camera. I tweaked around with some of the settings and made additional tests (in manual and auto). Again, the pictures were very disappointing. I compared the indoor and outdoor test shots I took around the house with pictures I had previously taken with my 8 megapixel Canon SD850. The difference was very apparent. In the interior pictures taken with my Canon, you could zoom in and see the details of the wood grain on furniture. In the Sony pictures, the details were blurred. The same was true with the outdoor pictures - you could see much more details in the pictures taken with my old Canon. I went back and reset all the user settings to default and made another set of tests. The results were the same. I then tested the HD video capabilities (indoors and outdoors) and was again let down. The video looked over-exposed. I adjusted the EV setting on the camera, but it made very little difference. I also noticed a lot of lens flares even in the indoor shots. This was not what I expected.I tried to convince myself that I was missing something obvious, so I looked through the manual, tweaked around with the settings again, and even cleaned the lens. I took several more tests, but with the same results. Believe me, I really wanted to like this camera, but reasons for keeping it were quickly diminishing. Having read the 5-star reviews here and on other sites, I am convinced that the camera I received is defective, which is why I didn't give the camera a lower rating. Reluctantly, I will be returning the camera. However at this point, I'm not sure if I would purchase the Sony again or go for the Canon, at least not before my cruise.

Reviews.Title: Liked the camera
Reviews.Author: S ks "S ks"
Reviews.Content: I bought this one too long ago about 2009 as a gift and reviewing now.My uncle's family is still using this camera. Now there are so many good cameras with less price and higher resolution.But this one was good of it's time, that time very rare camera used to come with HD video recording.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber - shot camera
Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: This Sony Cyber - Shot SDC-W290 12.1 MP digital camera with 5x optical zoom is one of two that we own. Good camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality control, poor performance
Reviews.Author: Patrick E Weithers
Reviews.Content: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290 12 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and Super Steady Shot Image Stabilization (Dark Blue)My Son and I each purchased a Sony Cybershot DSC-W290 camera a few years ago.  I recall us having problems formatting the non-Sony memory cards purchased with each camera.  Consequently, we both ordering additional SD cards made by Sony.  I kept my cybershot DSC-W290 for use as a backup camera. I used it for the first time during a vacation trip last week, and all outdoor images totally blanked out.  It was obviously that the amplifier in the CCD image sensor and/or the A/D converter was flawed out of the box and I just never knew it.  The lens on the Sony cybershot DSC-W290 purchased by my son stopped working. He purchased a Samsung camera and he is very happy with it. Sony tech support offered to repair mine for over $107.34 if I sent it to their repair center, or 15% off on a new one; I understand that CCD circuits are expensive, but better Quality Control by Sony on this product would have allowed me to add vacation pictures to my family album.  My Nikon and Samsung cameras have never given a problem after years of use. I regret not taking one of them with me on my trip as I have in the past.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy a sony camera to photograph your kids
Reviews.Author: no more sony
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Sony cyber-shot digital camera, model DSC-W290 to photograph my infant.  This camera stopped working after six months.
