Sony repaired it that time (I was without a camera for several weeks.)  Now, just one year later the camera has stopped again.  A Sony customer service representative told me that they cannot possibly know for how long their cameras will work; even one year cannot be guaranteed.  This product is a waste of time and money.  Do not buy it if you want an easy reliable camera.  Sony offered me an insulting 15% discount on a new camera.  I plan to go with Canon now and take advantage of upcoming holiday sales.Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and Super Steady Shot Image Stabilization (Black)

Reviews.Title: So So...
Reviews.Author: Erick Acuna "Emau08"
Reviews.Content: with day light or with indoor lights works fine but the flash sucks and with no light ¨before the flash shoots¨ you can't never focus the imagen.Also for all those reviweres who love write and write let me tell you all, whatever you have to say if you can't say it in five lines is useless.

Reviews.Title: not real happy
Reviews.Author: Connie Swartz
Reviews.Content: One of the few things I've bought through this site that I don't like.  We've had many problems with this camera and eventually replaced it with a different camera bought locally.

Reviews.Title: Worst digital camera EVER!
Reviews.Author: Emily C
Reviews.Content: We received this camera from my in-laws and I have been in a nightmare ever since. I have had about 5 different digital cameras before this one, all very inexpensive and built to be very simple point and shoot cameras. I have documented my daughter's childhood with these cameras and have always been able to just plug the camera in, download the pictures, and view them immediately. No problems at all.The Sony, however, is the worst design ever. All of the files save into different little folders in the camera. It's like a Windows PC disaster. At one point we needed to download the pictures and videos in order to take some more at an event, so we downloaded to a laptop without the special (read 'special ed') PMB software provided by Sony. Nothing happened. My past cameras - all played friendly with any computer, regardless of whether we downloaded the software. We were able to 'explore' the camera drive and look through the folders contained within it, finding all of our pictures in one of the folders. After downloading them over, we deleted all the files from the camera, inadvertently losing all of the videos which had been saved to a separate folder in the camera. This was really upsetting since the videos were of my son's first few days in the hospital and coming home for the first time. Awful design.The worst part is yet to come. All of the videos can ONLY be viewed in PMB. They save automatically as MP4 files that are supposed to play in QuickTime. I am running the latest version of QuickTime and the videos are AWFUL. They jump, the audio jumps, they're blurry, just awful. In PMB, they are perfect. So what the heck is one to do when sending a video by email or DVD disc to a family member? Send a pirated copy of PMB with them and instuct them to download the software and view the videos that way? Ridiculous. I have tried multiple MP4 to AVI or WMV converters to no avail. The products are all much lower quality versions of the video, if I get video at all. Often only results in audio.Finally, the camera itself is terrible. We frequently turn on the camera in a hurry to take a quick shot of a special moment that is about to be lost forever and find that we are still on 'video' from the use before. It takes a good 20 seconds to turn the video off and then switch to the still shot features. The function wheel is useless and should be done away with. All other digital cameras typically start up in still shot mode and then you have to take an extra step to switch to video. The camera also comes with either 'easy' mode or 'intelligent', which are both awful. The easy mode produces terribly pictures and the intelligent mode nevers focuses on the right subject. Terrible and expensive camera for anyone who wants easy pictures with ease import and viewing. I recommend a Kodak or HP over this.

Reviews.Title: Difficult to use, and disappointing picture quality
Reviews.Author: Racer Boy
Reviews.Content: In my experience, the Sony Cyber-Shot W290 camera has been pretty disappointing. I have found it to be difficult to use, simply because the controls are tiny! I have normal-sized hands and fingers, but have a terrible time telling if my index finger is on the shutter or not. Half of the time I end up looking at the top of the camera to see if my finger is positioned correctly, which is very frustrating if you are trying to snap off a picture quickly. As a matter of fact, I have missed a few good shots because of this.Also, you can't access some of the features that would be nice to change, such as the length of time the picture is displayed after taking it, or similar functions. This may not be a problem for most users, but I find it very irritating. My Fujifilm and Canon cameras allowed the user to change many of the menu functions, why doesn't Sony?Worst of all is that the picture quality just isn't very good. Outdoor shots are usually fine, but I have found that indoor pictures taken with the flash are always very over-exposed. I tried making changes in the user-accesable menus, but never could compensate for the over-exposure issue. I even tried sticking several layers of opaque tape over the flash to see if that would work, but as expected, the results were inconsistent.The build quality of the camera appears to be fairly good, and the battery life is also very good as well. But due to the user-unfriendliness and poor picture quality, I can't recommend this camera. I recently purchased a Panasonic DMC-ZS6 for about the same price, and have found it to be a superior camera in almost every way.

Reviews.Title: Recall issue - does not power up.
Reviews.Author: James D. Strawn "Problem Finder"
Reviews.Content: I had the same problem that another reviewer, Sara Tillman, described here. I kept good care of the camera and used it regularly for about 8 months until it started saying the battery was out. I bought new batteries, a new charger, etc, but the problem persisted. I contacted customer chat and did a power reset (hold power down for 15 seconds then wait one more minute and reinsert the battery) but the problem persisted. I got through to sony phone help -- 800-222-7669 -- after about 15 minutes, they said that it is under warranty (within on year of purchase) and that I can send it in for repair. I believe the issue is known (likely, since another reviewer had the problem) and that it may be covered by recall warranty no matter how long you've had the camera. I am sending the camera into the sony repair center in Texas today an I will update on how that goes.Oh, and when the camera WAS working, it was GREAT, for a portable point and shoot. The folks complaining about picture quality simply don't understand that the smaller lens size of any portable camera will reduce quality significantly. if you want best quality, get a real DSLR. My only grip is that Sony has done away with the little charging and download dock that they has on older models like the T1. That was SO CONVENIENT. You can still charge the w290 easy enough, you just have to remove the battery and put it in the charger, and for downloading there is a separate usb cable. Again, easy enough to use, but I sure miss that handy little dock that the t1 came with.Update: 10/25/10 - I got it back from the Sony repair center in about one week (I had to pay for shipping = lame) and then I used it one time and it broke again in exactly the same way. I called the tech center and they said they'll try fixing it again and this time they sent me a paid shipping label. I have to try that, since I really have no choice. I explained that this is my thrid cybershot and I was very happy with the first two and would happy to just by a newer cybershot model if I could get even a partial credit toward it due to this broken one they sold me. They said they don;t do that, so I will just have them keep trying to repair it and then just try to sell it on my own if and when that ever happens. In the meantime, I've said adios to the cybershot line for good and just bought myself a brand new Panasonic Lumix ZS7. It's still in the box as I write this, so let's just hope it works as godod as it looks and lasts a lot longer than my W290 lemon did. Good riddance!Bottom line is that I reccommend staying away from this or any other cybershot now. Because they might ship you a lemony product and then not stand by it and make no motion for a refund or any other consolation. You, the customer, will be out, as was I. boooo on sony!

Reviews.Content: liked the quality of the pictures, but the battery life is low. good price and great look. love the blue color.

Reviews.Title: Shame on SONY. The WORST camera I have ever used!
Reviews.Author: RXFS
Reviews.Content: I was actually very happy about this little SONY camera:Cool and stylish. Small and solid. Quick point and shoot... Until I saw the pictures on my computer!Seriously, those are simply the WORST pictures I have ever seen! The colors are not correct. The pictures are soft and FUZZY. In the same room, my ancient SAMASUNG Digimax S700 takes way sharper pictures than this SONY junk! I have had enough of this SONY junk after around 80 shots; it is going back!STAY AWAY FROM SONY DSC-W290 camera. Yeah, some camera it is.

Reviews.Title: Great But No Viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Robert Cyr
Reviews.Content: Image display is fine, but I prefer a viewfinder to compose my shots.  Sony has decided to eliminate the veiw finder, perhaps because amateurs like to hold the camera in front of them and check the display to see what they will get from the shot.  Am I getting old school?

Reviews.Title: easy to get a messy image in-doors
Reviews.Author: F. N. Tavares "Noris"
Reviews.Content: For out-doors picture, with good light conditions, the pictures are great and sharp. Amazing video capture.But I was really disappointed when taking pictures in-doors. In its Intelligent Auto Ajust Mode, the camera usually picks a high iso configuration when there's not a bright light inside a room (and I mean really bright), resulting in a bad quality picture. Looks like you're using a 0,5 Megapixel camera.Too bad I didn't know much about the ISO settings before buying this camera. High ISO yields bad quality pictures, because the idea is to obtain a brighter picture in low light conditions. I wish this camera had a smarter ISO auto-ajustment.

Reviews.Title: excellent product

Reviews.Content: el producto excelente, aun no la manejo con facilidad por falta de tiempo para practicar.

Reviews.Title: 720p video clips does not play in PS3
Reviews.Author: Mr. 350Z "350Z"
Reviews.Content: I bought a Sony CyberShot (DSC-W290) specifically because it records 720p video (MPEG4). I recorded few clips and inserted the Memory Stick Pro-Duo into PS3 (and on Sony HDTV). It recognizes all my pictures but the video folders are empty. Either 720p standard or fine videos does not show in the folder to play. Only the video recorded with the lowest resolution (VGA) shows up and able play them (I was experimenting recording with all 3 options). I called Sony's camera Customer Service and they told me to use a different Memory Stick which I did (different brands) but same results. They told me that something is wrong with my PS3 and told me to contact PS3 Customer Service. I did that and they are telling any MPEG4 video should play on PS3 (no fireware updates needed) and telling me to call Sony's Camera Cust. Service. I tried connecting the USB to PS3 and playing the videos on the PS3 but still no luck.

Reviews.Title: No zoom while recording kills it
Reviews.Author: Ben Stevenson "BenS7"
Reviews.Content: I don't care how great the quality or photos are, not being able to zoom while recording is a big problem.  I'm very disappointed Sony decided to take this route because I have Sony digital cameras from 2004 that allowed you to zoom while recording so I do not understand why they took this huge step backward.  I've sold my camera for this reason and told people to stay away.  All the Kodaks that have been doing HD video since 2007 have been able to use full zoom while recording.

Reviews.Title: hola
Reviews.Author: Hello
Reviews.Content: I havent gotten my camera yet, but reading everybodys review, and checking other websites, Id say that this is a really good camera! It takes good quality pictures, a nice big screen, and its not too expensive either. You should definitley get it.

Reviews.Title: 720p video clips does not play in PS3
Reviews.Author: Mr. 350Z "350Z"
Reviews.Content: I bought a Sony CyberShot (DSC-W290) specifically because it records 720p video (MPEG4). I recorded few clips and inserted the Memory Stick Pro-Duo into PS3 (and on Sony HDTV). It recognizes all my pictures but the video folders are empty. Either 720p standard or fine videos does not show in the folder to play. Only the video recorded with the lowest resolution (VGA) shows up and able play them (I was experimenting recording with all 3 options). I called Sony's camera Customer Service and they told me to use a different Memory Stick which I did (different brands) but same results. They told me that something is wrong with my PS3 and told me to contact PS3 Customer Service. I did that and they are telling any MPEG4 video should play on PS3 (no fireware updates needed) and telling me to call Sony's Camera Cust. Service. I tried connecting the USB to PS3 and playing the videos on the PS3 but still no luck.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Not from Amazon (never arrived)

Reviews.Content: Great Camera, but had to buy it elsewhere because the one I ordered from Amazon, LLC never arrived.

Reviews.Title: REQUEST FOR INFORMATION
Reviews.Author: Gustavo Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: GOOD AFTERNOON, PLEASE SORRY BUT I NEED TO KNOW WHAT HAPPENED TO MAKE A FEW PURCHASES IN THE MONTH OF DECEMBER WHICH IT WAS RECEIVED IN MY CREDIT CARD AND UP TO THIS DATE HAVE NOT BEEN SENT ME, WHAT WERE THE FOLLOWING PRODUCT PURCHASED 02 Sony Cybershot DSC-W220 12.1MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom with Super Steady Shot Image Stabilization (Black), Sony 4 GB Memory Stick PRO Duo Flash Memory Card MSMT4G

ProductInfo.Features:
12.1-megapixel Super HAD CCD image sensor
5x optical zoom, 28mm wide-angle Carl Zeiss Vario-Tessar lens; Optical SteadyShot image stabilization
720p high-definition movie capture; BIONZ image processor
3.0-inch (230K pixels) Clear Photo LCD; Face Detection and Smile Shutter technology
11MB built-in memory; capture images to Memory Stick Duo/PRO Duo Media (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W290 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and Super Steady Shot Image Stabilization (Silver)
